549.omega: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect. It withers if a Trainer does not take good care of it.
549.alpha: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokemon is popular with celebrities.

579.omega: They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. They can crush boulders psychically.
579.alpha: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

218.omega: Molten magma courses throughout Slugma's circulatory system. If this Pokemon is chilled, the magma cools and hardens. Its body turns brittle and chunks fall off, reducing its size.
218.alpha: Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokemon's body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.

219.omega: Magcargo's shell is actually its skin that hardened as a result of cooling. Its shell is very brittle and fragile—just touching it causes it to crumble apart. This Pokemon returns to its original size by dipping itself in magma.
219.alpha: Magcargo's body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Water is vaporized on contact. If this Pokemon is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.

440.omega: It carries a round, egg-shaped rock in its belly pouch and gives the rock to its friends.
440.alpha: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It's bothered by how curly its hair looks.

712.omega: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
712.alpha: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

50.omega: Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple— wherever this Pokemon burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing delicious vegetables.
50.alpha: Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple— wherever this Pokemon burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing delicious vegetables.

679.omega: Apparently this Pokemon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.
679.alpha: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

713.omega: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
713.alpha: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.

714.omega: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
714.alpha: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.

715.omega: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.
715.alpha: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.

51.omega: Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.
51.alpha: Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.

716.omega: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
716.alpha: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

717.omega: When this legendary Pokemon's wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
717.alpha: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

718.omega: This is Zygarde's form when it has gathered 50% of its cells. It wipes out all those who oppose it, showing not a shred of mercy.
718.alpha: It's thought to be monitoring the ecosystem. There are rumors that even greater power lies hidden within it.

719.omega: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
719.alpha: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

52.omega: Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pokemon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
52.alpha: Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pokemon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.

740.omega: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokemon evolved and grew fur.
740.alpha: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.

741.omega: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.
741.alpha: This Oricorio has sipped red nectar. Its passionate dance moves cause its enemies to combust in both body and mind.

742.omega: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it's able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.
742.alpha: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.

743.omega: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.
743.alpha: Some of Ribombee's pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.

53.omega: Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the Pokemon's surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
53.alpha: Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the Pokemon's surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.

744.omega: It's considered to be a good Pokemon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.
744.alpha: This Pokemon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer's side.

745.omega: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.
745.alpha: When properly raised from a young age, it will become a trustworthy partner that will absolutely never betray its Trainer.

746.omega: When it's in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.
746.alpha: It's awfully weak and notably tasty, so everyone is always out to get it. As it happens, anyone trying to bully it receives a painful lesson.

747.omega: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.
747.alpha: It's found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola's head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokemon.

54.omega: Psyduck uses a mysterious power. When it does so, this Pokemon generates brain waves that are supposedly only seen in sleepers. This discovery spurred controversy among scholars.
54.alpha: If it uses its mysterious power, Psyduck can't remember having done so. It apparently can't form a memory of such an event because it goes into an altered state that is much like deep sleep.

748.omega: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.
748.alpha: Those attacked by Toxapex's poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.

749.omega: The mud stuck to Mudbray's hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
749.alpha: It has a stubborn, individualistic disposition. Eating dirt, making mud, and playing in the mire all form part of its daily routine.

770.omega: Possessed people controlled by this Pokemon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.
770.alpha: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.

771.omega: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.
771.alpha: These Pokemon line the beaches. The sticky mucous that covers their bodies can be used to soothe sunburned skin. How convenient!

55.omega: The webbed flippers on its forelegs and hind legs and the streamlined body of Golduck give it frightening speed. This Pokemon is definitely much faster than even the most athletic swimmer.
55.alpha: Golduck is the fastest swimmer among all Pokemon. It swims effortlessly, even in a rough, stormy sea. It sometimes rescues people from wrecked ships floundering in high seas.

772.omega: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokemon has some hidden special power.
772.alpha: Due to the danger that this synthetic Pokemon may go on a rampage, it wears a control mask to restrain its power.

773.omega: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokemon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.
773.alpha: Although its name was Type: Null at first, the boy who evolved it into this form gave it the name by which it is now known.

774.omega: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
774.alpha: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokemon was born from mutated nanoparticles.

10.omega: Caterpie has a voracious appetite. It can devour leaves bigger than its body right before your eyes. From its antenna, this Pokemon releases a terrifically strong odor.
10.alpha: Caterpie has a voracious appetite. It can devour leaves bigger than its body right before your eyes. From its antenna, this Pokemon releases a terrifically strong odor.

56.omega: When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
56.alpha: When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.

775.omega: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.
775.alpha: The log it holds was given to it by its parents at birth. It has also been known to cling to the arm of a friendly Trainer.

776.omega: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.
776.alpha: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.

777.omega: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokemon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.
777.alpha: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.

11.omega: The shell covering this Pokemon's body is as hard as an iron slab. Metapod does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the hard shell.
11.alpha: The shell covering this Pokemon's body is as hard as an iron slab. Metapod does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the hard shell.

57.omega: When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time.
57.alpha: When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time.

778.omega: Its actual appearance is unknown. A scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by terror and died from the shock.
778.alpha: A lonely Pokemon, it conceals its terrifying appearance beneath an old rag so it can get closer to people and other Pokemon.

779.omega: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.
779.alpha: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder's shell is no match for it.

90.omega: At night, this Pokemon uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, Shellder closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
90.alpha: At night, this Pokemon uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, Shellder closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.

12.omega: Butterfree has a superior ability to search for delicious honey from flowers. It can even search out, extract, and carry honey from flowers that are blooming over six miles from its nest.
12.alpha: Butterfree has a superior ability to search for delicious honey from flowers. It can even search out, extract, and carry honey from flowers that are blooming over six miles from its nest.

58.omega: Growlithe has a superb sense of smell. Once it smells anything, this Pokemon won't forget the scent, no matter what. It uses its advanced olfactory sense to determine the emotions of other living things.
58.alpha: Growlithe has a superb sense of smell. Once it smells anything, this Pokemon won't forget the scent, no matter what. It uses its advanced olfactory sense to determine the emotions of other living things.

91.omega: Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pokemon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
91.alpha: Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pokemon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.

92.omega: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pokemon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
92.alpha: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pokemon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.

93.omega: Haunter is a dangerous Pokemon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokemon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
93.alpha: Haunter is a dangerous Pokemon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokemon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.

13.omega: Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable of distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).
13.alpha: Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable of distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).

59.omega: Arcanine is known for its high speed. It is said to be capable of running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night. The fire that blazes wildly within this Pokemon's body is its source of power.
59.alpha: Arcanine is known for its high speed. It is said to be capable of running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night. The fire that blazes wildly within this Pokemon's body is its source of power.

94.omega: Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a streetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you. It is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be your shadow.
94.alpha: Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a streetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you. It is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be your shadow.

95.omega: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokemon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.
95.alpha: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokemon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.

96.omega: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that one of these Pokemon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
96.alpha: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that one of these Pokemon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.

14.omega: Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree. However, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares for its coming evolution. This is evident from how hot the shell becomes to the touch.
14.alpha: Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree. However, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares for its coming evolution. This is evident from how hot the shell becomes to the touch.

97.omega: Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis. While this Pokemon searches for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
97.alpha: Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis. While this Pokemon searches for prey, it polishes the pendulum.

98.omega: Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food, these Pokemon can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.
98.alpha: Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food, these Pokemon can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.

99.omega: Kingler has an enormous, oversized claw. It waves this huge claw in the air to communicate with others. However, because the claw is so heavy, the Pokemon quickly tires.
99.alpha: Kingler has an enormous, oversized claw. It waves this huge claw in the air to communicate with others. However, because the claw is so heavy, the Pokemon quickly tires.

15.omega: Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach its nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack in a furious swarm.
15.alpha: Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach its nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack in a furious swarm.

16.omega: Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.
16.alpha: Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.

17.omega: Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This Pokemon flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.
17.alpha: Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This Pokemon flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.

18.omega: This Pokemon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokemon.
18.alpha: This Pokemon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokemon.

19.omega: Rattata is cautious in the extreme. Even while it is asleep, it constantly listens by moving its ears around. It is not picky about where it lives—it will make its nest anywhere.
19.alpha: Rattata is cautious in the extreme. Even while it is asleep, it constantly listens by moving its ears around. It is not picky about where it lives—it will make its nest anywhere.

120.omega: Staryu's center section has an organ called the core that shines bright red. If you go to a beach toward the end of summer, the glowing cores of these Pokemon look like the stars in the sky.
120.alpha: Staryu apparently communicates with the stars in the night sky by flashing the red core at the center of its body. If parts of its body are torn, this Pokemon simply regenerates the missing pieces and limbs.

220.omega: Swinub roots for food by rubbing its snout against the ground. Its favorite food is a mushroom that grows under the cover of dead grass. This Pokemon occasionally roots out hot springs.
220.alpha: Swinub roots for food by rubbing its snout against the ground. Its favorite food is a mushroom that grows under the cover of dead grass. This Pokemon occasionally roots out hot springs.

121.omega: Starmie's center section—the core—glows brightly in seven colors. Because of its luminous nature, this Pokemon has been given the nickname “the gem of the sea.
121.alpha: Starmie swims through water by spinning its star-shaped body as if it were a propeller on a ship. The core at the center of this Pokemon's body glows in seven colors.

320.omega: Wailmer's nostrils are located above its eyes. This playful Pokemon loves to startle people by forcefully snorting out seawater it stores inside its body out of its nostrils.
320.alpha: Wailmer can store water inside its body to transform itself into a ball for bouncing around on the ground. By filling itself up with more water, this Pokemon can elevate the height of its bounces.

221.omega: Piloswine is covered by a thick coat of long hair that enables it to endure the freezing cold. This Pokemon uses its tusks to dig up food that has been buried under ice.
221.alpha: Piloswine is covered by a thick coat of long hair that enables it to endure the freezing cold. This Pokemon uses its tusks to dig up food that has been buried under ice.

122.omega: Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists as if it were real.
122.alpha: Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists as if it were real.

420.omega: Sunlight colors it red. When the small ball is drained of nutrients, it shrivels to herald evolution.
420.alpha: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.

321.omega: Wailord is the largest of all identified Pokemon up to now. This giant Pokemon swims languorously in the vast open sea, eating massive amounts of food at once with its enormous mouth.
321.alpha: When chasing prey, Wailord herds them by leaping out of the water and making a humongous splash. It is breathtaking to see this Pokemon leaping out of the sea with others in its pod.

80.omega: Slowbro's tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
80.alpha: Slowbro's tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.

222.omega: Corsola's branches glitter very beautifully in seven colors when they catch sunlight. If any branch breaks off, this Pokemon grows it back in just one night.
222.alpha: Clusters of Corsola congregate in warm seas where they serve as ideal hiding places for smaller Pokemon. When the water temperature falls, this Pokemon migrates to the southern seas.

520.omega: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.
520.alpha: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.

123.omega: Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This Pokemon's scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
123.alpha: Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This Pokemon's scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.

421.omega: During times of strong sunlight, its bud blooms, its petals open fully, and it becomes very active.
421.alpha: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.

81.omega: Magnemite attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity. If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers. You may find a large number of this Pokemon clinging to the breaker box.
81.alpha: Magnemite floats in the air by emitting electromagnetic waves from the units at its sides. These waves block gravity. This Pokemon becomes incapable of flight if its internal electrical supply is depleted.

620.omega: It wields the fur on its arms like a whip. Its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.
620.alpha: Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it launches into combo attacks that, once started, no one can stop.

322.omega: Numel is extremely dull witted—it doesn't notice being hit. However, it can't stand hunger for even a second. This Pokemon's body is a seething cauldron of boiling magma.
322.alpha: Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the Pokemon's body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.

223.omega: Remoraid sucks in water, then expels it at high velocity using its abdominal muscles to shoot down flying prey. When evolution draws near, this Pokemon travels downstream from rivers.
223.alpha: Remoraid sucks in water, then expels it at high velocity using its abdominal muscles to shoot down flying prey. When evolution draws near, this Pokemon travels downstream from rivers.

521.omega: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females' flying abilities surpass those of the males.
521.alpha: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.

82.omega: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pokemon.
82.alpha: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to electronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is said that some towns warn people to keep this Pokemon inside a Poke Ball.

124.omega: Jynx walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without giving any thought to what they are doing.
124.alpha: Jynx walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without giving any thought to what they are doing.

422.omega: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
422.alpha: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.

720.omega: In its true form, it possesses a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.
720.alpha: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

621.omega: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.
621.alpha: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.

323.omega: Camerupt has a volcano inside its body. Magma of 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. Occasionally, the humps on this Pokemon's back erupt, spewing the superheated magma.
323.alpha: The humps on Camerupt's back are formed by a transformation of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma. This Pokemon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.

83.omega: Farfetch'd is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This Pokemon has been known to fight with others over stalks.
83.alpha: Farfetch'd is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This Pokemon has been known to fight with others over stalks.

224.omega: Octillery grabs onto its foe using its tentacles. This Pokemon tries to immobilize it before delivering the finishing blow. If the foe turns out to be too strong, Octillery spews ink to escape.
224.alpha: Octillery grabs onto its foe using its tentacles. This Pokemon tries to immobilize it before delivering the finishing blow. If the foe turns out to be too strong, Octillery spews ink to escape.

522.omega: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.
522.alpha: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

84.omega: Doduo's two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two heads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep watch for enemies while the other one sleeps.
84.alpha: Doduo's two heads contain completely identical brains. A scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be examples of this Pokemon possessing different sets of brains.

125.omega: When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pokemon compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of lightning rods.
125.alpha: When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pokemon compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of lightning rods.

423.omega: When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple fluid and escapes.
423.alpha: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.

150.omega: Mewtwo is a Pokemon that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans created this Pokemon's body, they failed to endow Mewtwo with a compassionate heart.
150.alpha: Mewtwo is a Pokemon that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans created this Pokemon's body, they failed to endow Mewtwo with a compassionate heart.

622.omega: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.
622.alpha: Ancient science fashioned this Pokemon from clay. It's been active for thousands of years.

324.omega: Torkoal digs through mountains in search of coal. If it finds some, it fills hollow spaces on its shell with the coal and burns it. If it is attacked, this Pokemon spouts thick black smoke to beat a retreat.
324.alpha: Torkoal generates energy by burning coal. It grows weaker as the fire dies down. When it is preparing for battle, this Pokemon burns more coal.

721.omega: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
721.alpha: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

225.omega: Delibird carries its food bundled up in its tail. There once was a famous explorer who managed to reach the peak of the world's highest mountain, thanks to one of these Pokemon sharing its food.
225.alpha: Delibird carries its food bundled up in its tail. There once was a famous explorer who managed to reach the peak of the world's highest mountain, thanks to one of these Pokemon sharing its food.

40.omega: Wigglytuff has large, saucerlike eyes. The surfaces of its eyes are always covered with a thin layer of tears. If any dust gets in this Pokemon's eyes, it is quickly washed away.
40.alpha: Wigglytuff's body is very flexible. By inhaling deeply, this Pokemon can inflate itself seemingly without end. Once inflated, Wigglytuff bounces along lightly like a balloon.

250.omega: Ho-Oh's feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokemon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.
250.alpha: Ho-Oh's feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokemon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.

126.omega: In battle, Magmar blows out intensely hot flames from all over its body to intimidate its opponent. This Pokemon's fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in its surroundings.
126.alpha: In battle, Magmar blows out intensely hot flames from all over its body to intimidate its opponent. This Pokemon's fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in its surroundings.

523.omega: When this ill-tempered Pokemon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
523.alpha: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

151.omega: Mew is said to possess the genetic composition of all Pokemon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.
151.alpha: Mew is said to possess the genetic composition of all Pokemon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.

41.omega: Zubat remains quietly unmoving in a dark spot during the bright daylight hours. It does so because prolonged exposure to the sun causes its body to become slightly burned.
41.alpha: Zubat avoids sunlight because exposure causes it to become unhealthy. During the daytime, it stays in caves or under the eaves of old houses, sleeping while hanging upside down.

623.omega: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokemon by the ancient people who made them.
623.alpha: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

350.omega: Milotic is said to be the most beautiful of all the Pokemon. It has the power to becalm such emotions as anger and hostility to quell bitter feuding.
350.alpha: Milotic live at the bottom of large lakes. When this Pokemon's body glows a vivid pink, it releases a pulsing wave of energy that brings soothing calm to troubled hearts.

226.omega: On sunny days, schools of Mantine can be seen elegantly leaping over the sea's waves. This Pokemon is not bothered by the Remoraid that hitches rides.
226.alpha: On sunny days, schools of Mantine can be seen elegantly leaping over the sea's waves. This Pokemon is not bothered by the Remoraid that hitches rides.

524.omega: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.
524.alpha: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.

42.omega: Golbat loves to drink the blood of living things. It is particularly active in the pitch black of night. This Pokemon flits around in the night skies, seeking fresh blood.
42.alpha: Golbat bites down on prey with its four fangs and drinks the victim's blood. It becomes active on inky dark moonless nights, flying around to attack people and Pokemon.

127.omega: Pinsir is astoundingly strong. It can grip a foe weighing twice its weight in its horns and easily lift it. This Pokemon's movements turn sluggish in cold places.
127.alpha: Pinsir has a pair of massive horns. Protruding from the surface of these horns are thorns. These thorns are driven deeply into the foe's body when the pincer closes, making it tough for the foe to escape.

251.omega: This Pokemon came from the future by crossing over time. It is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.
251.alpha: This Pokemon came from the future by crossing over time. It is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.

450.omega: It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of sand while attacking.
450.alpha: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

624.omega: Blades comprise this Pokemon's entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.
624.alpha: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.

43.omega: During the daytime, Oddish buries itself in soil to absorb nutrients from the ground using its entire body. The more fertile the soil, the glossier its leaves become.
43.alpha: Oddish searches for fertile, nutrient-rich soil, then plants itself. During the daytime, while it is planted, this Pokemon's feet are thought to change shape and become similar to the roots of trees.

351.omega: Castform's appearance changes with the weather. This Pokemon gained the ability to use the vast power of nature to protect its tiny body.
351.alpha: Castform borrows the power of nature to transform itself into the guises of the sun, rain, and snow-clouds. This Pokemon's feelings change with the weather.

227.omega: Skarmory is entirely encased in hard, protective armor. This Pokemon flies at close to 190 mph. It slashes foes with its wings that possess swordlike cutting edges.
227.alpha: Skarmory's steel wings become tattered and bashed in from repeated battles. Once a year, the battered wings grow back completely, restoring the cutting edges to their pristine state.

152.omega: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokemon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.
152.alpha: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokemon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.

252.omega: Treecko has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable it to scale vertical walls. This Pokemon attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.
252.alpha: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokemon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.

128.omega: This Pokemon is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times. If there is no opponent for Tauros to battle, it will charge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.
128.alpha: This Pokemon is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times. If there is no opponent for Tauros to battle, it will charge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.

44.omega: Gloom releases a foul fragrance from the pistil of its flower. When faced with danger, the stench worsens. If this Pokemon is feeling calm and secure, it does not release its usual stinky aroma.
44.alpha: From its mouth Gloom drips honey that smells absolutely horrible. Apparently, it loves the horrid stench. It sniffs the noxious fumes and then drools even more of its honey.

451.omega: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
451.alpha: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

625.omega: This pitiless Pokemon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
625.alpha: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.

153.omega: Bayleef's neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.
153.alpha: Bayleef's neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.

352.omega: Kecleon is capable of changing its body colors at will to blend in with its surroundings. There is one exception—this Pokemon can't change the zigzag pattern on its belly.
352.alpha: Kecleon alters its body coloration to blend in with its surroundings, allowing it to sneak up on its prey unnoticed. Then it lashes out with its long, stretchy tongue to instantly ensnare the unsuspecting target.

228.omega: Houndour hunt as a coordinated pack. They communicate with each other using a variety of cries to corner their prey. This Pokemon's remarkable teamwork is unparalleled.
228.alpha: Houndour hunt as a coordinated pack. They communicate with each other using a variety of cries to corner their prey. This Pokemon's remarkable teamwork is unparalleled.

45.omega: Vileplume's toxic pollen triggers atrocious allergy attacks. That's why it is advisable never to approach any attractive flowers in a jungle, however pretty they may be.
45.alpha: Vileplume has the world's largest petals. They are used to attract prey that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the prey are immobilized, this Pokemon catches and devours them.

253.omega: The leaves growing out of Grovyle's body are convenient for camouflaging it from enemies in the forest. This Pokemon is a master at climbing trees in jungles.
253.alpha: This Pokemon adeptly flies from branch to branch in trees. In a forest, no Pokemon can ever hope to catch a fleeing Grovyle however fast they may be.

129.omega: Magikarp is a pathetic excuse for a Pokemon that is only capable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted scientists to undertake research into it.
129.alpha: Magikarp is virtually useless in battle as it can only splash around. As a result, it is considered to be weak. However, it is actually a very hardy Pokemon that can survive in any body of water no matter how polluted it is.

46.omega: Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug Pokemon host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.
46.alpha: Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug Pokemon host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.

452.omega: It takes pride in its strength. Even though it can tear foes apart, it finishes them off with powerful poison.
452.alpha: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

626.omega: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.
626.alpha: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

154.omega: The fragrance of Meganium's flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokemon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe's fighting spirit.
154.alpha: The fragrance of Meganium's flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokemon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe's fighting spirit.

353.omega: Shuppet is attracted by feelings of jealousy and vindictiveness. If someone develops strong feelings of vengeance, this Pokemon will appear in a swarm and line up beneath the eaves of that person's home.
353.alpha: Shuppet grows by feeding on dark emotions, such as vengefulness and envy, in the hearts of people. It roams through cities in search of grudges that taint people.

229.omega: In a Houndoom pack, the one with its horns raked sharply toward the back serves a leadership role. These Pokemon choose their leader by fighting among themselves.
229.alpha: In a Houndoom pack, the one with its horns raked sharply toward the back serves a leadership role. These Pokemon choose their leader by fighting among themselves.

47.omega: Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
47.alpha: Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.

552.omega: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
552.alpha: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.

254.omega: The leaves growing on Sceptile's body are very sharp edged. This Pokemon is very agile—it leaps all over the branches of trees and jumps on its foe from above or behind.
254.alpha: Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokemon raises the trees in a forest with loving care.

525.omega: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
525.alpha: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.

453.omega: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
453.alpha: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

48.omega: Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey.
48.alpha: Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey.

627.omega: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.
627.alpha: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.

354.omega: Banette generates energy for laying strong curses by sticking pins into its own body. This Pokemon was originally a pitiful plush doll that was thrown away.
354.alpha: A cursed energy permeated the stuffing of a discarded and forgotten plush doll, giving it new life as Banette. The Pokemon's energy would escape if it were to ever open its mouth.

155.omega: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokemon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
155.alpha: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokemon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.

49.omega: Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokemon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
49.alpha: Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokemon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.

553.omega: Very violent Pokemon, they try to clamp down on anything that moves in front of their eyes.
553.alpha: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.

255.omega: Torchic sticks with its Trainer, following behind with unsteady steps. This Pokemon breathes fire of over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit, including fireballs that leave the foe scorched black.
255.alpha: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokemon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.

526.omega: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.
526.alpha: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.

454.omega: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
454.alpha: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

628.omega: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
628.alpha: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.

156.omega: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokemon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.
156.alpha: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokemon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.

355.omega: Duskull can pass through any wall no matter how thick it may be. Once this Pokemon chooses a target, it will doggedly pursue the intended victim until the break of dawn.
355.alpha: Duskull wanders lost among the deep darkness of midnight. There is an oft-told admonishment given to misbehaving children that this Pokemon will spirit away bad children who earn scoldings from their mothers.

527.omega: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.
527.alpha: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.

380.omega: Latias is highly sensitive to the emotions of people. If it senses any hostility, this Pokemon ruffles the feathers all over its body and cries shrilly to intimidate the foe.
380.alpha: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokemon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.

554.omega: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.
554.alpha: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.

256.omega: Combusken toughens up its legs and thighs by running through fields and mountains. This Pokemon's legs possess both speed and power, enabling it to dole out 10 kicks in one second.
256.alpha: Combusken battles with the intensely hot flames it spews from its beak and with outstandingly destructive kicks. This Pokemon's cry is very loud and distracting.

528.omega: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.
528.alpha: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

455.omega: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.
455.alpha: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

629.omega: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.
629.alpha: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.

480.omega: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
480.alpha: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

356.omega: Dusclops's body is completely hollow—there is nothing at all inside. It is said that its body is like a black hole. This Pokemon will absorb anything into its body, but nothing will ever come back out.
356.alpha: Dusclops absorbs anything, however large the object may be. This Pokemon hypnotizes its foe by waving its hands in a macabre manner and by bringing its single eye to bear. The hypnotized foe is made to do Dusclops's bidding.

157.omega: Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokemon creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.
157.alpha: Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokemon creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.

381.omega: Latios has the ability to make others see an image of what it has seen or imagines in its head. This Pokemon is intelligent and understands human speech.
381.alpha: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokemon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.

555.omega: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.
555.alpha: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

257.omega: In battle, Blaziken blows out intense flames from its wrists and attacks foes courageously. The stronger the foe, the more intensely this Pokemon's wrists burn.
257.alpha: Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This Pokemon's blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.

580.omega: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.
580.alpha: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

456.omega: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
456.alpha: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.

158.omega: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile's jaws are very powerful. While the Pokemon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.
158.alpha: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile's jaws are very powerful. While the Pokemon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.

481.omega: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
481.alpha: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake's surface.

357.omega: The bunches of fruit around Tropius's neck are very popular with children. This Pokemon loves fruit, and eats it continuously. Apparently, its love for fruit resulted in its own outgrowth of fruit.
357.alpha: Children of the southern tropics eat as snacks the fruit that grows in bunches around the neck of Tropius. This Pokemon flies by flapping the leaves on its back as if they were wings.

529.omega: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.
529.alpha: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.

680.omega: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.
680.alpha: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

556.omega: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokemon that prey on its flower seeds.
556.alpha: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.

258.omega: The fin on Mudkip's head acts as highly sensitive radar. Using this fin to sense movements of water and air, this Pokemon can determine what is taking place around it without using its eyes.
258.alpha: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokemon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.

581.omega: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.
581.alpha: This Pokemon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.

457.omega: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.
457.alpha: To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the seafloor using the two fins on its chest.

159.omega: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.
159.alpha: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.

482.omega: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
482.alpha: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.

358.omega: Chimecho makes its cries echo inside its hollow body. When this Pokemon becomes enraged, its cries result in ultrasonic waves that have the power to knock foes flying.
358.alpha: In high winds, Chimecho cries as it hangs from a tree branch or the eaves of a building using a suction cup on its head. This Pokemon plucks berries with its long tail and eats them.

382.omega: Through Primal Reversion and with nature's full power, it will take back its true form. It can summon storms that cause the sea levels to rise.
382.alpha: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.

681.omega: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokemon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokemon.
681.alpha: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

557.omega: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokemon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.
557.alpha: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

259.omega: The surface of Marshtomp's body is enveloped by a thin, sticky film that enables it to live on land. This Pokemon plays in mud on beaches when the ocean tide is low.
259.alpha: Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at swimming. This Pokemon's hindquarters exhibit obvious development, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.

582.omega: The temperature of their breath is -58 degrees Fahrenheit. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.
582.alpha: Snowy mountains are this Pokemon's habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.

458.omega: The pattern on its back varies by region. It often swims in a school of Remoraid.
458.alpha: When it swims close to the surface of the ocean, people aboard ships are able to observe the pattern on its back.

383.omega: Groudon is said to be the personification of the land itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Kyogre, as each sought to gain the power of nature.
383.alpha: Through Primal Reversion and with nature's full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.

483.omega: A Pokemon spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.
483.alpha: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

359.omega: Every time Absol appears before people, it is followed by a disaster such as an earthquake or a tidal wave. As a result, it came to be known as the disaster Pokemon.
359.alpha: Absol has the ability to foretell the coming of natural disasters. It lives in a harsh, rugged mountain environment. This Pokemon very rarely ventures down from the mountains.

424.omega: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.
424.alpha: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.

682.omega: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.
682.alpha: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.

558.omega: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.
558.alpha: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.

384.omega: Rayquaza is said to have lived for hundreds of millions of years. Legends remain of how it put to rest the clash between Kyogre and Groudon.
384.alpha: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.

583.omega: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.
583.alpha: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry, cause violent blizzards.

459.omega: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
459.alpha: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

280.omega: Ralts senses the emotions of people using the horns on its head. This Pokemon rarely appears before people. But when it does, it draws closer if it senses that the person has a positive disposition.
280.alpha: Ralts has the ability to sense the emotions of people. If its Trainer is in a cheerful mood, this Pokemon grows cheerful and joyous in the same way.

484.omega: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.
484.alpha: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

425.omega: A Pokemon formed by the spirits of people and Pokemon. It loves damp, humid seasons.
425.alpha: These Pokemon are called the “Signpost for Wandering Spirits.” Children holding them sometimes vanish.

281.omega: It is said that a Kirlia that is exposed to the positive emotions of its Trainer grows beautiful. This Pokemon controls psychokinetic powers with its highly developed brain.
281.alpha: Kirlia uses the horns on its head to amplify its psychokinetic power. When the Pokemon uses its power, the air around it becomes distorted, creating mirages of nonexistent scenery.

683.omega: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.
683.alpha: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.

559.omega: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
559.alpha: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.

385.omega: A legend states that Jirachi will make true any wish that is written on notes attached to its head when it awakens. If this Pokemon senses danger, it will fight without awakening.
385.alpha: Jirachi will awaken from its sleep of a thousand years if you sing to it in a voice of purity. It is said to make true any wish that people desire.

584.omega: If both heads get angry simultaneously, this Pokemon expels a blizzard, burying everything in snow.

426.omega: It carries people and Pokemon when it flies. But since it only drifts, it can end up anywhere.
426.alpha: It's drowsy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.

282.omega: Gardevoir has the ability to read the future. If it senses impending danger to its Trainer, this Pokemon is said to unleash its psychokinetic energy at full power.
282.alpha: Gardevoir has the psychokinetic power to distort the dimensions and create a small black hole. This Pokemon will try to protect its Trainer even at the risk of its own life.

485.omega: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
485.alpha: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

427.omega: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
427.alpha: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.

283.omega: From the tips of its feet, Surskit secretes an oil that enables it to walk on water as if it were skating. This Pokemon feeds on microscopic organisms in ponds and lakes.
283.alpha: If Surskit senses danger, it secretes a thick, sugary syrup from the tip of its head. There are some Pokemon that love eating this syrup.

684.omega: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.
684.alpha: Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.

386.omega: The DNA of a space virus underwent a sudden mutation upon exposure to a laser beam and resulted in Deoxys. The crystalline organ on this Pokemon's chest appears to be its brain.
386.alpha: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokemon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.

428.omega: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.
428.alpha: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.

585.omega: Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.
585.alpha: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokemon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

284.omega: Masquerain intimidates enemies with the eyelike patterns on its antennas. This Pokemon flaps its four wings to freely fly in any direction—even sideways and backwards—as if it were a helicopter.
284.alpha: Masquerain's antennas have eyelike patterns that usually give it an angry look. If the “eyes are droopy and appear sad, it is said to be a sign that a heavy rainfall is on its way.

429.omega: It chants incantations. While they usually torment targets, some chants bring happiness.
429.alpha: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.

486.omega: It is said to have made Pokemon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
486.alpha: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokemon towed continents with ropes.

285.omega: Shroomish live in damp soil in the dark depths of forests. They are often found keeping still under fallen leaves. This Pokemon feeds on compost that is made up of fallen, rotted leaves.
285.alpha: If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This Pokemon's spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.

286.omega: Breloom closes in on its foe with light and sprightly footwork, then throws punches with its stretchy arms. This Pokemon's fighting technique puts boxers to shame.
286.alpha: The seeds ringing Breloom's tail are made of hardened toxic spores. It is horrible to eat the seeds. Just taking a bite of this Pokemon's seed will cause your stomach to rumble.

685.omega: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.
685.alpha: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a human's, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. It's like it can see with its nose!

387.omega: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.
387.alpha: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

287.omega: Slakoth lolls around for over 20 hours every day. Because it moves so little, it does not need much food. This Pokemon's sole daily meal consists of just three leaves.
287.alpha: Slakoth's heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokemon in motion.

586.omega: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck's horns.
586.alpha: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

288.omega: Vigoroth is always itching and agitated to go on a wild rampage. It simply can't tolerate sitting still for even a minute. This Pokemon's stress level rises if it can't be moving constantly.
288.alpha: Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this Pokemon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.

650.omega: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.
650.alpha: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn't faze it.

487.omega: This Pokemon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.
487.alpha: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

651.omega: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators' attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.
651.alpha: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won't start fights.

652.omega: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.
652.alpha: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

686.omega: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.
686.alpha: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

388.omega: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe its treed shell.
388.alpha: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokemon there on its back.

653.omega: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.
653.alpha: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

587.omega: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.
587.alpha: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.

289.omega: Slaking spends all day lying down and lolling about. It eats grass growing within its reach. If it eats all the grass it can reach, this Pokemon reluctantly moves to another spot.
289.alpha: Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear in grassy fields. They are made by the Pokemon as it eats all the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.

654.omega: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.
654.alpha: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

488.omega: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
488.alpha: Those who sleep holding Cresselia's feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

655.omega: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.
655.alpha: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

656.omega: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.
656.alpha: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

687.omega: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokemon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.
687.alpha: It lures its prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.

389.omega: Ancient people imagined that beneath the ground, a gigantic Torterra dwelled.
389.alpha: Small Pokemon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

657.omega: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.
657.alpha: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.

588.omega: These mysterious Pokemon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.
588.alpha: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.

180.omega: Flaaffy's wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.
180.alpha: Flaaffy's wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.

325.omega: Spoink bounces around on its tail. The shock of its bouncing makes its heart pump. As a result, this Pokemon cannot afford to stop bouncing—if it stops, its heart will stop.
325.alpha: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokemon's psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.

489.omega: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.
489.alpha: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

658.omega: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.
658.alpha: It appears and vanishes with a ninja's grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

181.omega: Ampharos gives off so much light that it can be seen even from space. People in the old days used the light of this Pokemon to send signals back and forth with others far away.
181.alpha: Ampharos gives off so much light that it can be seen even from space. People in the old days used the light of this Pokemon to send signals back and forth with others far away.

688.omega: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.
688.alpha: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.

326.omega: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to amplify its psychic power waves for gaining total control over its foe. When this Pokemon uses its special power, its snorting breath grows labored.
326.alpha: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This Pokemon's black pearls are valuable as works of art.

659.omega: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.
659.alpha: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

589.omega: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.
589.alpha: These Pokemon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.

182.omega: When Bellossom gets exposed to plenty of sunlight, the leaves ringing its body begin to spin around. This Pokemon's dancing is renowned in the southern lands.
182.alpha: A Bellossom grows flowers more beautifully if it has evolved from a smelly Gloom—the more stinky the better. At night, this Pokemon closes its petals and goes to sleep.

327.omega: All the Spinda that exist in the world are said to have utterly unique spot patterns. The shaky, tottering steps of this Pokemon give it the appearance of dancing.
327.alpha: No two Spinda are said to have identical spot patterns on their hides. This Pokemon moves in a curious manner as if it is stumbling in dizziness. Its lurching movements can cause the opponent to become confused.

183.omega: Marill's oil-filled tail acts much like a life preserver. If you see just its tail bobbing on the water's surface, it's a sure indication that this Pokemon is diving beneath the water to feed on aquatic plants.
183.alpha: When fishing for food at the edge of a fast-running stream, Marill wraps its tail around the trunk of a tree. This Pokemon's tail is flexible and configured to stretch.

328.omega: Trapinch's nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit dug in sand. This Pokemon patiently waits for prey to tumble down the pit. Its giant jaws have enough strength to crush even boulders.
328.alpha: Trapinch is a patient hunter. It digs an inescapable pit in a desert and waits for its prey to come tumbling down. This Pokemon can go a whole week without access to any water.

184.omega: Azumarill's long ears are indispensable sensors. By focusing its hearing, this Pokemon can identify what kinds of prey are around, even in rough and fast-running rivers.
184.alpha: Azumarill can make balloons out of air. It makes these air balloons if it spots a drowning Pokemon. The air balloons enable the Pokemon in trouble to breathe.

689.omega: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.
689.alpha: Barbaracle's legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head's orders.

329.omega: To make prey faint, Vibrava generates ultrasonic waves by vigorously making its two wings vibrate. This Pokemon's ultrasonic waves are so powerful, they can bring on headaches in people.
329.alpha: Vibrava's wings have not yet completed the process of growing. Rather than flying long distances, they are more useful for generating ultrasonic waves by vibrating.

185.omega: Sudowoodo camouflages itself as a tree to avoid being attacked by enemies. However, because its hands remain green throughout the year, the Pokemon is easily identified as a fake during the winter.
