185.alpha: Sudowoodo camouflages itself as a tree to avoid being attacked by enemies. However, because its hands remain green throughout the year, the Pokemon is easily identified as a fake during the winter.

186.omega: The curled hair on Politoed's head is proof of its status as a king. It is said that the longer and more curled the hair, the more respect this Pokemon earns from its peers.
186.alpha: The curled hair on Politoed's head is proof of its status as a king. It is said that the longer and more curled the hair, the more respect this Pokemon earns from its peers.

187.omega: This Pokemon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.
187.alpha: This Pokemon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.

188.omega: Skiploom's flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokemon is sometimes used as a thermometer.
188.alpha: Skiploom's flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokemon is sometimes used as a thermometer.

550.omega: Red- and blue-striped Basculin are very violent and always fighting. They are also remarkably tasty.
550.alpha: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other's school.

189.omega: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokemon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
189.alpha: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokemon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.

551.omega: It moves along below the sand's surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.
551.alpha: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.

722.omega: This wary Pokemon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.
722.alpha: Silently it glides, drawing near its targets. Before they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with vicious kicks.

723.omega: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
723.alpha: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.

724.omega: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.
724.alpha: Although basically cool and cautious, when it's caught by surprise, it's seized by panic.

725.omega: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
725.alpha: It doesn't allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.

726.omega: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokemon spits fire.
726.alpha: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.

727.omega: This Pokemon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it's not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer's orders with complete nonchalance.
727.alpha: After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.

728.omega: This Pokemon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It's famous for being a hard worker.
728.alpha: This Pokemon can control water bubbles. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.

729.omega: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.
729.alpha: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.

750.omega: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.
750.alpha: Its heavy, mud-covered kicks are its best means of attack, and it can reduce large trucks to scrap without breaking a sweat.

751.omega: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.
751.alpha: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokemon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.

752.omega: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokemon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.
752.alpha: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokemon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.

753.omega: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.
753.alpha: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.

754.omega: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis's vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.
754.alpha: It fires beams from its sickle-shaped petals. These beams are powerful enough to cleave through thick metal plates.

755.omega: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.
755.alpha: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.

756.omega: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.
756.alpha: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokemon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.

757.omega: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
757.alpha: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokemon, then attacks them.

758.omega: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.
758.alpha: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.

759.omega: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.
759.alpha: A touch from anyone except a known friend sends it into a surging frenzy. It's an incredibly dangerous Pokemon.

780.omega: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.
780.alpha: This Pokemon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.

781.omega: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.
781.alpha: The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokemon. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.

782.omega: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.
782.alpha: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. Jangmo-o grow little by little as they battle one another.

783.omega: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.
783.alpha: It sheds and regrows its scales on a continuous basis. The scales become harder and sharper each time they're regrown.

784.omega: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.
784.alpha: Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other commodities.

785.omega: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.
785.alpha: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.

786.omega: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.
786.alpha: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.

787.omega: It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around. It causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth.
787.alpha: The guardian deity of Ula'ula is a lazy Pokemon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.

788.omega: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.
788.alpha: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.

789.omega: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.
789.alpha: In ages past, it was called the child of the stars. It's said to be a Pokemon from another world, but no specific details are known.

85.omega: Watch out if Dodrio's three heads are looking in three separate directions. It's a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don't go near this Pokemon if it's being wary—it may decide to peck you.
85.alpha: Apparently, the heads aren't the only parts of the body that Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.

86.omega: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
86.alpha: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.

87.omega: Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokemon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
87.alpha: Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokemon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.

88.omega: Grimer's sludgy and rubbery body can be forced through any opening, however small it may be. This Pokemon enters sewer pipes to drink filthy wastewater.
88.alpha: Grimer emerged from the sludge that settled on a polluted seabed. This Pokemon loves anything filthy. It constantly leaks a horribly germ-infested fluid from all over its body.

89.omega: From Muk's body seeps a foul fluid that gives off a nose-bendingly horrible stench. Just one drop of this Pokemon's body fluid can turn a pool stagnant and rancid.
89.alpha: This Pokemon's favorite food is anything that is repugnantly filthy. In dirty towns where people think nothing of throwing away litter on the streets, Muk are certain to gather.

70.omega: Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the Pokemon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
70.alpha: Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the Pokemon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.

71.omega: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pokemon swallows it whole.
71.alpha: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pokemon swallows it whole.

72.omega: Tentacool's body is largely composed of water. If it is removed from the sea, it dries up like parchment. If this Pokemon happens to become dehydrated, put it back into the sea.
72.alpha: Tentacool absorbs sunlight and refracts it using water inside its body to convert it into beam energy. This Pokemon shoots beams from the small round organ above its eyes.

73.omega: Tentacruel has large red orbs on its head. The orbs glow before lashing the vicinity with a harsh ultrasonic blast. This Pokemon's outburst creates rough waves around it.
73.alpha: Tentacruel has tentacles that can be freely elongated and shortened at will. It ensnares prey with its tentacles and weakens the prey by dosing it with a harsh toxin. It can catch up to 80 prey at the same time.

74.omega: The longer a Geodude lives, the more its edges are chipped and worn away, making it more rounded in appearance. However, this Pokemon's heart will remain hard, craggy, and rough always.
74.alpha: When Geodude sleeps deeply, it buries itself halfway into the ground. It will not awaken even if hikers step on it unwittingly. In the morning, this Pokemon rolls downhill in search of food.

75.omega: Graveler grows by feeding on rocks. Apparently, it prefers to eat rocks that are covered in moss. This Pokemon eats its way through a ton of rocks on a daily basis.
75.alpha: Rocks are Graveler's favorite food. This Pokemon will climb a mountain from the base to the summit, crunchingly feasting on rocks all the while. Upon reaching the peak, it rolls back down to the bottom.

30.omega: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pokemon appears to become nervous if separated from the others.
30.alpha: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pokemon appears to become nervous if separated from the others.

76.omega: Golem live up on mountains. If there is a large earthquake, these Pokemon will come rolling down off the mountains en masse to the foothills below.
76.alpha: Golem is known for rolling down from mountains. To prevent them from rolling into the homes of people downhill, grooves have been dug into the sides of mountains to serve as guideways for diverting this Pokemon's course.

31.omega: Nidoqueen's body is encased in extremely hard scales. It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles. This Pokemon is at its strongest when it is defending its young.
31.alpha: Nidoqueen's body is encased in extremely hard scales. It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles. This Pokemon is at its strongest when it is defending its young.

77.omega: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokemon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.
77.alpha: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokemon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.

32.omega: Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pokemon's notice.
32.alpha: Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pokemon's notice.

78.omega: Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains. However, when this Pokemon turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.
78.alpha: Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains. However, when this Pokemon turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.

33.omega: Nidorino has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might.
33.alpha: Nidorino has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might.

79.omega: Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pokemon often forgets what it's doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.
79.alpha: Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pokemon often forgets what it's doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.

34.omega: Nidoking's thick tail packs enormously destructive power. With one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower. Once this Pokemon goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.
34.alpha: Nidoking's thick tail packs enormously destructive power. With one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower. Once this Pokemon goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.

35.omega: On every night of a full moon, groups of this Pokemon come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Clefairy return to their quiet mountain retreats and go to sleep nestled up against each other.
35.alpha: On every night of a full moon, groups of this Pokemon come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Clefairy return to their quiet mountain retreats and go to sleep nestled up against each other.

36.omega: Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its wings. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water. It is known to take strolls on lakes on quiet, moonlit nights.
36.alpha: Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its wings. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water. It is known to take strolls on lakes on quiet, moonlit nights.

37.omega: At the time of its birth, Vulpix has one white tail. The tail separates into six if this Pokemon receives plenty of love from its Trainer. The six tails become magnificently curled.
37.alpha: Inside Vulpix's body burns a flame that never goes out. During the daytime, when the temperatures rise, this Pokemon releases flames from its mouth to prevent its body from growing too hot.

1.omega: Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun's rays, the seed grows progressively larger.
1.alpha: Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun's rays, the seed grows progressively larger.

2.omega: There is a bud on this Pokemon's back. To support its weight, Ivysaur's legs and trunk grow thick and strong. If it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight, it's a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon.
2.alpha: There is a bud on this Pokemon's back. To support its weight, Ivysaur's legs and trunk grow thick and strong. If it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight, it's a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon.

38.omega: Ninetales casts a sinister light from its bright red eyes to gain total control over its foe's mind. This Pokemon is said to live for a thousand years.
38.alpha: Legend has it that Ninetales came into being when nine wizards possessing sacred powers merged into one. This Pokemon is highly intelligent—it can understand human speech.

3.omega: There is a large flower on Venusaur's back. The flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower's aroma soothes the emotions of people.
3.alpha: There is a large flower on Venusaur's back. The flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower's aroma soothes the emotions of people.

39.omega: Jigglypuff's vocal cords can freely adjust the wavelength of its voice. This Pokemon uses this ability to sing at precisely the right wavelength to make its foes most drowsy.
39.alpha: When this Pokemon sings, it never pauses to breathe. If it is in a battle against an opponent that does not easily fall asleep, Jigglypuff cannot breathe, endangering its life.

4.omega: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pokemon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.
4.alpha: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pokemon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.

5.omega: Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive. In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color.
5.alpha: Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive. In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color.

6.omega: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.
6.alpha: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.

100.omega: Voltorb was first sighted at a company that manufactures Poke Balls. The link between that sighting and the fact that this Pokemon looks very similar to a Poke Ball remains a mystery.
100.alpha: Voltorb is extremely sensitive—it explodes at the slightest of shocks. It is rumored that it was first created when a Poke Ball was exposed to a powerful pulse of energy.

7.omega: Squirtle's shell is not merely used for protection. The shell's rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pokemon to swim at high speeds.
7.alpha: Squirtle's shell is not merely used for protection. The shell's rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pokemon to swim at high speeds.

8.omega: Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokemon's toughness as a battler.
8.alpha: Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokemon's toughness as a battler.

200.omega: Misdreavus frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. The Pokemon apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fearful feelings of foes and turn them into nutrition.
200.alpha: Misdreavus frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. The Pokemon apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fearful feelings of foes and turn them into nutrition.

9.omega: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.
9.alpha: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.

101.omega: Electrode eats electricity in the atmosphere. On days when lightning strikes, you can see this Pokemon exploding all over the place from eating too much electricity.
101.alpha: One of Electrode's characteristics is its attraction to electricity. It is a problematical Pokemon that congregates mostly at electrical power plants to feed on electricity that has just been generated.

300.omega: Skitty has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects and chasing them around. This Pokemon is known to chase after its own tail and become dizzy.
300.alpha: Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this Pokemon lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.

201.omega: This Pokemon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.
201.alpha: This Pokemon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.

400.omega: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.
400.alpha: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

102.omega: This Pokemon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is close to evolution.
102.alpha: This Pokemon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is close to evolution.

301.omega: Delcatty prefers to live an unfettered existence in which it can do as it pleases at its own pace. Because this Pokemon eats and sleeps whenever it decides, its daily routines are completely random.
301.alpha: Delcatty sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent nest. If other Pokemon approach it as it sleeps, this Pokemon will never fight—it will just move away somewhere else.

500.omega: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
500.alpha: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

202.omega: If two or more Wobbuffet meet, they will turn competitive and try to outdo each other's endurance. However, they may try to see which one can endure the longest without food. Trainers need to beware of this habit.
202.alpha: Wobbuffet does nothing but endure attacks—it won't attack on its own. However, it won't endure an attack on its tail. When that happens, the Pokemon will try to take the foe with it using Destiny Bond.

401.omega: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.
401.alpha: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

103.omega: Exeggutor originally came from the tropics. Its heads steadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall off, they group together to form Exeggcute.
103.alpha: Exeggutor originally came from the tropics. Its heads steadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall off, they group together to form Exeggcute.

600.omega: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.
600.alpha: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn't return, it will die.

302.omega: Sableye lead quiet lives deep inside caverns. They are feared, however, because these Pokemon are thought to steal the spirits of people when their eyes burn with a sinister glow in the darkness.
302.alpha: Sableye digs the ground with sharpened claws to find rocks that it eats. Substances in the eaten rocks crystallize and rise up to the Pokemon's body surface.

501.omega: The scalchop on its stomach isn't just used for battle—it can be used to break open hard berries as well.
501.alpha: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

203.omega: Girafarig's rear head also has a brain, but it is small. The rear head attacks in response to smells and sounds. Approaching this Pokemon from behind can cause the rear head to suddenly lash out and bite.
203.alpha: Girafarig's rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn't need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.

700.omega: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.
700.alpha: It wraps its ribbonlike feelers around the arm of its beloved Trainer and walks with him or her.

402.omega: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
402.alpha: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.

104.omega: Cubone pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull the Pokemon wears are made by the tears it sheds.
104.alpha: Cubone pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull the Pokemon wears are made by the tears it sheds.

601.omega: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.
601.alpha: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

303.omega: Mawile's huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed. Its docile-looking face serves to lull its foe into letting down its guard. When the foe least expects it, Mawile chomps it with its gaping jaws.
303.alpha: Don't be taken in by this Pokemon's cute face—it's very dangerous. Mawile fools the foe into letting down its guard, then chomps down with its massive jaws. The steel jaws are really horns that have been transformed.

502.omega: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.
502.alpha: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

204.omega: Pineco hangs from a tree branch and patiently waits for prey to come along. If the Pokemon is disturbed while eating by someone shaking its tree, it drops down to the ground and explodes with no warning.
204.alpha: Pineco hangs from a tree branch and patiently waits for prey to come along. If the Pokemon is disturbed while eating by someone shaking its tree, it drops down to the ground and explodes with no warning.

800.omega: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
800.alpha: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It has an extraordinarily vicious disposition and is constantly firing off laser beams.

701.omega: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.
701.alpha: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.

403.omega: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
403.alpha: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

130.omega: When Magikarp evolves into Gyarados, its brain cells undergo a structural transformation. It is said that this transformation is to blame for this Pokemon's wildly violent nature.
130.alpha: Once Gyarados goes on a rampage, its ferociously violent blood doesn't calm until it has burned everything down. There are records of this Pokemon's rampages lasting a whole month.

602.omega: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
602.alpha: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

304.omega: This Pokemon has a body of steel. To make its body, Aron feeds on iron ore that it digs from mountains. Occasionally, it causes major trouble by eating bridges and rails.
304.alpha: Aron has a body of steel. With one all-out charge, this Pokemon can demolish even a heavy dump truck. The destroyed dump truck then becomes a handy meal for the Pokemon.

105.omega: Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has overcome its sadness at the loss of its mother and grown tough. This Pokemon's tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.
105.alpha: Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has overcome its sadness at the loss of its mother and grown tough. This Pokemon's tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.

503.omega: In the time it takes a foe to blink, it can draw and sheathe the seamitars attached to its front legs.
503.alpha: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

205.omega: Forretress conceals itself inside its hardened steel shell. The shell is opened when the Pokemon is catching prey, but it does so at such a quick pace that the shell's inside cannot be seen.
205.alpha: Forretress conceals itself inside its hardened steel shell. The shell is opened when the Pokemon is catching prey, but it does so at such a quick pace that the shell's inside cannot be seen.

230.omega: Kingdra lives at extreme ocean depths that are otherwise uninhabited. It has long been believed that the yawning of this Pokemon creates spiraling ocean currents.
230.alpha: Kingdra sleeps on the seafloor where it is otherwise devoid of life. When a storm arrives, the Pokemon is said to awaken and wander about in search of prey.

702.omega: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.
702.alpha: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

404.omega: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
404.alpha: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

131.omega: People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, this Pokemon is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
131.alpha: People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, this Pokemon is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.

603.omega: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.
603.alpha: These Pokemon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

305.omega: Lairon tempers its steel body by drinking highly nutritious mineral springwater until it is bloated. This Pokemon makes its nest close to springs of delicious water.
305.alpha: Lairon feeds on iron contained in rocks and water. It makes its nest on mountains where iron ore is buried. As a result, the Pokemon often clashes with humans mining the iron ore.

330.omega: Flygon is nicknamed “the elemental spirit of the desert. Because its flapping wings whip up a cloud of sand, this Pokemon is always enveloped in a sandstorm while flying.
330.alpha: Flygon whips up a sandstorm by flapping its wings. The wings create a series of notes that sound like singing. Because the “singing is the only thing that can be heard in a sandstorm, this Pokemon is said to be the desert spirit.

504.omega: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.
504.alpha: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming from behind.

206.omega: Dunsparce has a drill for its tail. It uses this tail to burrow into the ground backward. This Pokemon is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.
206.alpha: Dunsparce has a drill for its tail. It uses this tail to burrow into the ground backward. This Pokemon is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.

231.omega: For its nest, Phanpy digs a vertical pit in the ground at the edge of a river. It marks the area around its nest with its trunk to let the others know that the area has been claimed.
231.alpha: Phanpy uses its long nose to shower itself. When others gather around, they thoroughly douse each other with water. These Pokemon can be seen drying their soaking-wet bodies at the edge of water.

703.omega: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
703.alpha: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.

405.omega: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey—even those taking shelter behind a wall.
405.alpha: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

132.omega: Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other shapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something by relying on its memory, this Pokemon manages to get details wrong.
132.alpha: Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other shapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something by relying on its memory, this Pokemon manages to get details wrong.

604.omega: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.
604.alpha: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

306.omega: Aggron claims an entire mountain as its own territory. It mercilessly beats up anything that violates its environment. This Pokemon vigilantly patrols its territory at all times.
306.alpha: Aggron is protective of its environment. If its mountain is ravaged by a landslide or a fire, this Pokemon will haul topsoil to the area, plant trees, and beautifully restore its own territory.

331.omega: Cacnea lives in arid locations such as deserts. It releases a strong aroma from its flower to attract prey. When prey comes near, this Pokemon shoots sharp thorns from its body to bring the victim down.
331.alpha: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokemon battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.

505.omega: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.
505.alpha: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

207.omega: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokemon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.
207.alpha: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokemon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.

232.omega: Donphan's favorite attack is curling its body into a ball, then charging at its foe while rolling at high speed. Once it starts rolling, this Pokemon can't stop very easily.
232.alpha: If Donphan were to tackle with its hard body, even a house could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the Pokemon helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.

406.omega: When it feels the sun's warm touch, it opens its bud to release pollen. It lives alongside clear pools.
406.alpha: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.

530.omega: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
530.alpha: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

133.omega: Eevee has an unstable genetic makeup that suddenly mutates due to the environment in which it lives. Radiation from various stones causes this Pokemon to evolve.
133.alpha: Eevee has an unstable genetic makeup that suddenly mutates due to the environment in which it lives. Radiation from various stones causes this Pokemon to evolve.

605.omega: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent's brain, causing unendurable headaches.
605.alpha: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.

307.omega: Meditite undertakes rigorous mental training deep in the mountains. However, whenever it meditates, this Pokemon always loses its concentration and focus. As a result, its training never ends.
307.alpha: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokemon's training.

332.omega: During the daytime, Cacturne remains unmoving so that it does not lose any moisture to the harsh desert sun. This Pokemon becomes active at night when the temperature drops.
332.alpha: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokemon are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.

506.omega: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.
506.alpha: Though it is a very brave Pokemon, it's also smart enough to check its foe's strength and avoid battle.

630.omega: They fly in circles around the sky. When they spot prey, they attack and carry it back to their nest with ease.
630.alpha: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokemon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.

233.omega: Porygon2 was created by humans using the power of science. The man-made Pokemon has been endowed with artificial intelligence that enables it to learn new gestures and emotions on its own.
233.alpha: Porygon2 was created by humans using the power of science. The man-made Pokemon has been endowed with artificial intelligence that enables it to learn new gestures and emotions on its own.

407.omega: Luring prey with a sweet scent, it uses poison whips on its arms to poison, bind, and finish off the prey.
407.alpha: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.

531.omega: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.
531.alpha: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

134.omega: Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow it to live underwater. This Pokemon has the ability to freely control water.
134.alpha: Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow it to live underwater. This Pokemon has the ability to freely control water.

606.omega: Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven't been decoded.
606.alpha: It uses psychic power to control an opponent's brain and tamper with its memories.

308.omega: It is said that through meditation, Medicham heightens energy inside its body and sharpens its sixth sense. This Pokemon hides its presence by merging itself with fields and mountains.
308.alpha: Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers. This Pokemon is known to meditate for a whole month without eating.

333.omega: Swablu has light and fluffy wings that are like cottony clouds. This Pokemon is not frightened of people. It lands on the heads of people and sits there like a cotton-fluff hat.
333.alpha: Swablu loves to make things clean. If it spots something dirty, it will wipe and polish it with its cottony wings. If its wings become dirty, this Pokemon finds a stream and showers itself.

507.omega: This very loyal Pokemon helps Trainers, and it also takes care of other Pokemon.
507.alpha: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.

631.omega: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant's steel bodies and consume their insides.
631.alpha: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.

234.omega: Stantler's magnificent antlers were traded at high prices as works of art. As a result, this Pokemon was hunted close to extinction by those who were after the priceless antlers.
234.alpha: Stantler's magnificent antlers were traded at high prices as works of art. As a result, this Pokemon was hunted close to extinction by those who were after the priceless antlers.

408.omega: It was resurrected from an iron ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its headbutts.
408.alpha: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with headbutts.

532.omega: These Pokemon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.
532.alpha: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.

135.omega: Jolteon's cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the Pokemon to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.
135.alpha: Jolteon's cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the Pokemon to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.

607.omega: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.
607.alpha: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokemon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

160.omega: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.
160.alpha: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.

334.omega: Altaria dances and wheels through the sky among billowing, cotton-like clouds. By singing melodies in its crystal-clear voice, this Pokemon makes its listeners experience dreamy wonderment.
334.alpha: Altaria sings in a gorgeous soprano. Its wings are like cotton clouds. This Pokemon catches updrafts with its buoyant wings and soars way up into the wild blue yonder.

508.omega: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. Its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.
508.alpha: Being wrapped in its long fur is so comfortable that a person would be fine even overnight on a wintry mountain.

632.omega: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.
632.alpha: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

235.omega: Smeargle marks the boundaries of its territory using a body fluid that leaks out from the tip of its tail. Over 5,000 different marks left by this Pokemon have been found.
235.alpha: Smeargle marks the boundaries of its territory using a body fluid that leaks out from the tip of its tail. Over 5,000 different marks left by this Pokemon have been found.

409.omega: Its skull withstands impacts of any magnitude. As a result, its brain never gets the chance to grow.
409.alpha: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.

260.omega: Swampert is very strong. It has enough power to easily drag a boulder weighing more than a ton. This Pokemon also has powerful vision that lets it see even in murky water.
260.alpha: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.

136.omega: Flareon's fluffy fur has a functional purpose—it releases heat into the air so that its body does not get excessively hot. This Pokemon's body temperature can rise to a maximum of 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
136.alpha: Flareon's fluffy fur has a functional purpose—it releases heat into the air so that its body does not get excessively hot. This Pokemon's body temperature can rise to a maximum of 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.

608.omega: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.
608.alpha: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

161.omega: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokemon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
161.alpha: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokemon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.

335.omega: Memories of battling its archrival Seviper are etched into every cell of Zangoose's body. This Pokemon adroitly dodges attacks with incredible agility.
335.alpha: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokemon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.

509.omega: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.
509.alpha: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can't help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

360.omega: Wynaut can always be seen with a big, happy smile on its face. Look at its tail to determine if it is angry. When angered, this Pokemon will be slapping the ground with its tail.
360.alpha: Wynaut gather on moonlit nights to play by squeezing up against each other. By being squeezed, this Pokemon gains endurance and is trained to dole out powerful counterattacks.

236.omega: Tyrogue becomes stressed out if it does not get to train every day. When raising this Pokemon, the Trainer must establish and uphold various training methods.
236.alpha: Tyrogue becomes stressed out if it does not get to train every day. When raising this Pokemon, the Trainer must establish and uphold various training methods.

633.omega: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.
633.alpha: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

261.omega: At first sight, Poochyena takes a bite at anything that moves. This Pokemon chases after prey until the victim becomes exhausted. However, it may turn tail if the prey strikes back.
261.alpha: Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This Pokemon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.

137.omega: Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace. This Pokemon is copy protected so it cannot be duplicated by copying.
137.alpha: Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace. This Pokemon is copy protected so it cannot be duplicated by copying.

609.omega: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
609.alpha: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

460.omega: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as “The Ice Monster.”
460.alpha: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

336.omega: Seviper shares a generations-long feud with Zangoose. The scars on its body are evidence of vicious battles. This Pokemon attacks using its sword-edged tail.
336.alpha: Seviper's swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokemon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.

634.omega: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
634.alpha: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

361.omega: Snorunt live in regions with heavy snowfall. In seasons without snow, such as spring and summer, this Pokemon steals away to live quietly among stalactites and stalagmites deep in caverns.
361.alpha: Snorunt survives by eating only snow and ice. Old folklore claims that a house visited by this Pokemon is sure to prosper for many generations to come.

237.omega: Hitmontop spins on its head at high speed, all the while delivering kicks. This technique is a remarkable mix of both offense and defense at the same time. The Pokemon travels faster spinning than it does walking.
237.alpha: Hitmontop spins on its head at high speed, all the while delivering kicks. This technique is a remarkable mix of both offense and defense at the same time. The Pokemon travels faster spinning than it does walking.

162.omega: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokemon is very nimble and fleet.
162.alpha: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokemon is very nimble and fleet.

560.omega: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.
560.alpha: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.

138.omega: Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokemon that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.
138.alpha: Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokemon that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.

262.omega: Mightyena gives obvious signals when it is preparing to attack. It starts to growl deeply and then flattens its body. This Pokemon will bite savagely with its sharply pointed fangs.
262.alpha: Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory of its life in the wild compels the Pokemon to obey only those Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.

461.omega: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.
461.alpha: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

337.omega: Lunatone was discovered at a location where a meteoroid fell. As a result, some people theorize that this Pokemon came from space. However, no one has been able to prove this theory so far.
337.alpha: Lunatone becomes active around the time of the full moon. Instead of walking, it moves by floating in midair. The Pokemon's intimidating red eyes cause all those who see it to become transfixed with fear.

635.omega: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
635.alpha: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokemon devours everything in its path!

362.omega: Glalie has a body made of rock, which it hardens with an armor of ice. This Pokemon has the ability to freeze moisture in the atmosphere into any shape it desires.
362.alpha: Glalie has the ability to freely control ice. For example, it can instantly freeze its prey solid. After immobilizing its prey in ice, this Pokemon enjoys eating it in leisurely fashion.

238.omega: Smoochum actively runs about, but also falls quite often. Whenever the chance arrives, it will look for its reflection to make sure its face hasn't become dirty.
238.alpha: Smoochum actively runs about, but also falls quite often. Whenever the chance arrives, it will look for its reflection to make sure its face hasn't become dirty.

163.omega: Hoothoot has an internal organ that senses and tracks the earth's rotation. Using this special organ, this Pokemon begins hooting at precisely the same time every day.
163.alpha: Hoothoot has an internal organ that senses and tracks the earth's rotation. Using this special organ, this Pokemon begins hooting at precisely the same time every day.

561.omega: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.
561.alpha: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

139.omega: Omastar uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large and heavy, causing its movements to become too slow and ponderous.
139.alpha: Omastar uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large and heavy, causing its movements to become too slow and ponderous.

263.omega: Zigzagoon restlessly wanders everywhere at all times. This Pokemon does so because it is very curious. It becomes interested in anything that it happens to see.
263.alpha: The hair on Zigzagoon's back is bristly. It rubs the hard back hair against trees to leave its territorial markings. This Pokemon may play dead to fool foes in battle.

462.omega: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.
462.alpha: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

338.omega: Solrock is a new species of Pokemon that is said to have fallen from space. It floats in air and moves silently. In battle, this Pokemon releases intensely bright light.
338.alpha: Sunlight is the source of Solrock's power. It is said to possess the ability to read the emotions of others. This Pokemon gives off intense heat while rotating its body.

636.omega: Said to have been born from the sun, it spews fire from its horns and encases itself in a cocoon of fire when it evolves.
636.alpha: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.

363.omega: Spheal is much faster rolling than walking to get around. When groups of this Pokemon eat, they all clap at once to show their pleasure. Because of this, their mealtimes are noisy.
363.alpha: Spheal always travels by rolling around on its ball-like body. When the season for ice floes arrives, this Pokemon can be seen rolling about on ice and crossing the sea.

239.omega: Elekid stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this Pokemon begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.
239.alpha: Elekid stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this Pokemon begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.

164.omega: Noctowl never fails at catching prey in darkness. This Pokemon owes its success to its superior vision that allows it to see in minimal light, and to its soft, supple wings that make no sound in flight.
164.alpha: Noctowl never fails at catching prey in darkness. This Pokemon owes its success to its superior vision that allows it to see in minimal light, and to its soft, supple wings that make no sound in flight.

562.omega: These Pokemon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.
562.alpha: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

264.omega: Linoone always runs full speed and only in straight lines. If facing an obstacle, it makes a right-angle turn to evade it. This Pokemon is very challenged by gently curving roads.
264.alpha: When hunting, Linoone will make a beeline straight for the prey at a full run. While this Pokemon is capable of topping 60 mph, it has to come to a screeching halt before it can turn.

309.omega: Electrike stores electricity in its long body hair. This Pokemon stimulates its leg muscles with electric charges. These jolts of power give its legs explosive acceleration performance.
309.alpha: Electrike runs faster than the human eye can follow. The friction from running is converted into electricity, which is then stored in this Pokemon's fur.

463.omega: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.
463.alpha: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.

339.omega: Barboach's sensitive whiskers serve as a superb radar system. This Pokemon hides in mud, leaving only its two whiskers exposed while it waits for prey to come along.
339.alpha: Barboach's body is covered with a slimy film. If a foe grabs it, this Pokemon just slips out of the enemy's grip. This Pokemon grows weak if the slimy coating dries up.

190.omega: Aipom's tail ends in a hand-like appendage that can be cleverly manipulated. However, because the Pokemon uses its tail so much, its real hands have become rather clumsy.
190.alpha: Aipom's tail ends in a hand-like appendage that can be cleverly manipulated. However, because the Pokemon uses its tail so much, its real hands have become rather clumsy.

364.omega: Sealeo has the habit of always juggling on the tip of its nose anything it sees for the first time. This Pokemon occasionally entertains itself by balancing and rolling a Spheal on its nose.
364.alpha: Sealeo often balances and rolls things on the tip of its nose. While the Pokemon is rolling something, it checks the object's aroma and texture to determine whether it likes the object or not.

637.omega: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.
637.alpha: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona's fire provided a replacement for the sun.

165.omega: Ledyba secretes an aromatic fluid from where its legs join its body. This fluid is used for communicating with others. This Pokemon conveys its feelings to others by altering the fluid's scent.
165.alpha: Ledyba secretes an aromatic fluid from where its legs join its body. This fluid is used for communicating with others. This Pokemon conveys its feelings to others by altering the fluid's scent.

563.omega: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.
563.alpha: Restored from a fossil, this Pokemon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.

265.omega: Using the spikes on its rear end, Wurmple peels the bark off trees and feeds on the sap that oozes out. This Pokemon's feet are tipped with suction pads that allow it to cling to glass without slipping.
265.alpha: Wurmple is targeted by Swellow as prey. This Pokemon will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.

533.omega: With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel beams to take down buildings.
533.alpha: This Pokemon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

464.omega: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.
464.alpha: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.

638.omega: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokemon obey it.
638.alpha: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokemon.

191.omega: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.
191.alpha: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.

663.omega: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.
663.alpha: When attacking prey, it can reach speeds of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off with a colossal kick.

365.omega: Walrein's two massively developed tusks can totally shatter blocks of ice weighing 10 tons with one blow. This Pokemon's thick coat of blubber insulates it from subzero temperatures.
365.alpha: Walrein swims all over in frigid seawater while crushing icebergs with its grand, imposing tusks. Its thick layer of blubber makes enemy attacks bounce off harmlessly.

166.omega: It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the sky, there live Ledian in countless numbers. There is a good reason for this—the Pokemon uses the light of the stars as its energy.
166.alpha: It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the sky, there live Ledian in countless numbers. There is a good reason for this—the Pokemon uses the light of the stars as its energy.

564.omega: About 100 million years ago, these Pokemon swam in oceans. It is thought they also went on land to attack prey.
564.alpha: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.

266.omega: Silcoon tethers itself to a tree branch using silk to keep from falling. There, this Pokemon hangs quietly while it awaits evolution. It peers out of the silk cocoon through a small hole.
266.alpha: Silcoon was thought to endure hunger and not consume anything before its evolution. However, it is now thought that this Pokemon slakes its thirst by drinking rainwater that collects on its silk.

534.omega: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
534.alpha: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.

465.omega: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
465.alpha: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

639.omega: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokemon is spoken of in legends.
639.alpha: Spoken of in legend, this Pokemon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokemon.

192.omega: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.
192.alpha: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.

664.omega: When under attack from bird Pokemon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.
664.alpha: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

366.omega: Clamperl's sturdy shell is not only good for protection—it is also used for clamping and catching prey. A fully grown Clamperl's shell will be scored with nicks and scratches all over.
366.alpha: Clamperl grows while being protected by its rock-hard shell. When its body becomes too large to fit inside the shell, it is sure evidence that this Pokemon is getting close to evolution.

490.omega: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokemon.
490.alpha: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokemon.

565.omega: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
565.alpha: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokemon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.

267.omega: Beautifly's favorite food is the sweet pollen of flowers. If you want to see this Pokemon, just leave a potted flower by an open window. Beautifly is sure to come looking for pollen.
267.alpha: Beautifly has a long mouth like a coiled needle, which is very convenient for collecting pollen from flowers. This Pokemon rides the spring winds as it flits around gathering pollen.

590.omega: It lures people in with its Poke Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poke Ball is unknown.
590.alpha: It lures Pokemon with its pattern that looks just like a Poke Ball, then releases poison spores.

466.omega: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
466.alpha: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.

167.omega: The web spun by Spinarak can be considered its second nervous system. It is said that this Pokemon can determine what kind of prey is touching its web just by the tiny vibrations it feels through the web's strands.
167.alpha: The web spun by Spinarak can be considered its second nervous system. It is said that this Pokemon can determine what kind of prey is touching its web just by the tiny vibrations it feels through the web's strands.

193.omega: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokemon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.
193.alpha: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokemon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.

665.omega: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.
665.alpha: The beaks of bird Pokemon can't begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

367.omega: Huntail's presence went unnoticed by people for a long time because it lives at extreme depths in the sea. This Pokemon's eyes can see clearly even in the murky dark depths of the ocean.
367.alpha: Huntail's tail is shaped like a fish. It uses the tail to attract prey, then swallows the prey whole with its large, gaping mouth. This Pokemon swims by wiggling its slender body like a snake.

690.omega: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.
690.alpha: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.

566.omega: Revived from a fossil, this Pokemon is thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokemon.
566.alpha: It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky by running at a speed of 25 mph.

268.omega: Cascoon makes its protective cocoon by wrapping its body entirely with a fine silk from its mouth. Once the silk goes around its body, it hardens. This Pokemon prepares for its evolution inside the cocoon.
268.alpha: If it is attacked, Cascoon remains motionless however badly it may be hurt. It does so because if it were to move, its body would be weak upon evolution. This Pokemon will also not forget the pain it endured.

591.omega: They show off their Poke Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokemon are fooled by this.
591.alpha: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poke Balls, in a swaying motion.

467.omega: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
467.alpha: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.

491.omega: It chases people and Pokemon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.
491.alpha: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

194.omega: Wooper usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes out onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with a gooey, toxic film.
194.alpha: Wooper usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes out onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with a gooey, toxic film.

666.omega: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
666.alpha: The patterns on this Pokemon's wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

368.omega: Gorebyss lives in the southern seas at extreme depths. Its body is built to withstand the enormous pressure of water at incredible depths. Because of this, this Pokemon's body is unharmed by ordinary attacks.
368.alpha: Although Gorebyss is the very picture of elegance and beauty while swimming, it is also cruel. When it spots prey, this Pokemon inserts its thin mouth into the prey's body and drains the prey of its body fluids.

691.omega: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.
691.alpha: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.

567.omega: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.
567.alpha: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.

269.omega: Dustox is instinctively drawn to light. Swarms of this Pokemon are attracted by the bright lights of cities, where they wreak havoc by stripping the leaves off roadside trees for food.
269.alpha: When Dustox flaps its wings, a fine dust is scattered all over. This dust is actually a powerful poison that will even make a pro wrestler sick. This Pokemon searches for food using its antennae like radar.

592.omega: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.
592.alpha: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.

468.omega: As everyone knows, it visits peaceful regions, bringing them gifts of kindness and sweet blessings.
468.alpha: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another's rights and avoid needless strife.

492.omega: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.
492.alpha: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

195.omega: Quagsire hunts for food by leaving its mouth wide open in water and waiting for its prey to blunder in unaware. Because the Pokemon does not move, it does not get very hungry.
195.alpha: Quagsire hunts for food by leaving its mouth wide open in water and waiting for its prey to blunder in unaware. Because the Pokemon does not move, it does not get very hungry.

667.omega: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.
667.alpha: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokemon are quick to fight.

369.omega: Relicanth is a Pokemon species that existed for a hundred million years without ever changing its form. This ancient Pokemon feeds on microscopic organisms with its toothless mouth.
369.alpha: Relicanth is a rare species that was discovered in deep-sea explorations. This Pokemon's body withstands the enormous water pressure of the ocean depths. Its body is covered in tough scales that are like craggy rocks.

692.omega: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.
692.alpha: Through controlled explosions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.

568.omega: The combination of garbage bags and industrial waste caused the chemical reaction that created this Pokemon.
568.alpha: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.

493.omega: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokemon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
493.alpha: It is told in mythology that this Pokemon was born before the universe even existed.

593.omega: Its body is mostly seawater. It's said there's a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.
593.alpha: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent's habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.

469.omega: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes' heads instantly while flying by at high speed.
469.alpha: This six-legged Pokemon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

168.omega: Ariados's feet are tipped with tiny hooked claws that enable it to scuttle on ceilings and vertical walls. This Pokemon constricts the foe with thin and strong silk webbing.
168.alpha: Ariados's feet are tipped with tiny hooked claws that enable it to scuttle on ceilings and vertical walls. This Pokemon constricts the foe with thin and strong silk webbing.

196.omega: Espeon is extremely loyal to any Trainer it considers to be worthy. It is said that this Pokemon developed its precognitive powers to protect its Trainer from harm.
196.alpha: Espeon is extremely loyal to any Trainer it considers to be worthy. It is said that this Pokemon developed its precognitive powers to protect its Trainer from harm.

668.omega: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.
668.alpha: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride's cubs.

494.omega: This Pokemon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.
494.alpha: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.

693.omega: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.
693.alpha: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.

569.omega: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.
569.alpha: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokemon.

169.omega: If this Pokemon is flying by fluttering only a pair of wings on either the forelegs or hind legs, it's proof that Crobat has been flying a long distance. It switches the wings it uses if it is tired.
169.alpha: Crobat sneaks up on its intended prey using wings that barely make a sound. This Pokemon rests by hanging on a tree branch with its rear legs that serve as wings.

594.omega: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokemon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.
594.alpha: It gently holds injured and weak Pokemon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.

390.omega: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can't extinguish the fire.
390.alpha: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

535.omega: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.
535.alpha: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

197.omega: Umbreon evolved as a result of exposure to the moon's waves. It hides silently in darkness and waits for its foes to make a move. The rings on its body glow when it leaps to attack.
197.alpha: Umbreon evolved as a result of exposure to the moon's waves. It hides silently in darkness and waits for its foes to make a move. The rings on its body glow when it leaps to attack.
