669.omega: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabebe holds is most likely part of its body.
669.alpha: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind's embrace with an untroubled heart.

495.omega: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.
495.alpha: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

694.omega: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.
694.alpha: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.

391.omega: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.
391.alpha: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

536.omega: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
536.alpha: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

595.omega: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokemon and absorbs static electricity.
595.alpha: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokemon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

392.omega: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.
392.alpha: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

537.omega: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.
537.alpha: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

198.omega: Murkrow was feared and loathed as the alleged bearer of ill fortune. This Pokemon shows strong interest in anything that sparkles or glitters. It will even try to steal rings from women.
198.alpha: Murkrow was feared and loathed as the alleged bearer of ill fortune. This Pokemon shows strong interest in anything that sparkles or glitters. It will even try to steal rings from women.

496.omega: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
496.alpha: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

393.omega: It doesn't like to be taken care of. It's difficult to bond with since it won't listen to its Trainer.
393.alpha: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

695.omega: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
695.alpha: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.

538.omega: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
538.alpha: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.

394.omega: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.
394.alpha: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.

596.omega: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.
596.alpha: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

539.omega: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.
539.alpha: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

395.omega: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.
395.alpha: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

199.omega: Slowking undertakes research every day in an effort to solve the mysteries of the world. However, this Pokemon apparently forgets everything it has learned if the Shellder on its head comes off.
199.alpha: Slowking undertakes research every day in an effort to solve the mysteries of the world. However, this Pokemon apparently forgets everything it has learned if the Shellder on its head comes off.

497.omega: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior's noble eyes.
497.alpha: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

396.omega: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
396.alpha: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokemon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

696.omega: This Pokemon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn't like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.
696.alpha: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.

208.omega: Steelix lives even further underground than Onix. This Pokemon is known to dig toward the earth's core. There are records of this Pokemon reaching a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.
208.alpha: Steelix lives even further underground than Onix. This Pokemon is known to dig toward the earth's core. There are records of this Pokemon reaching a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.

397.omega: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.
397.alpha: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.

597.omega: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.
597.alpha: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.

209.omega: By baring its fangs and making a scary face, Snubbull sends smaller Pokemon scurrying away in terror. However, this Pokemon seems a little sad at making its foes flee.
209.alpha: By baring its fangs and making a scary face, Snubbull sends smaller Pokemon scurrying away in terror. However, this Pokemon seems a little sad at making its foes flee.

398.omega: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokemon.
398.alpha: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.

498.omega: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.
498.alpha: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

430.omega: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called “Summoner of Night.”
430.alpha: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous Murkrow in tow.

431.omega: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.
431.alpha: When it's happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

697.omega: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.
697.alpha: Nothing could stop this Pokemon 100 million years ago, so it behaved like a king.

399.omega: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
399.alpha: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

432.omega: It would claim another Pokemon's nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.
432.alpha: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

598.omega: By swinging around its three spiky feelers and shooting spikes, it can obliterate an opponent.
598.alpha: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

433.omega: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.
433.alpha: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.

434.omega: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokemon away.
434.alpha: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

499.omega: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.
499.alpha: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

290.omega: Nincada lives underground for many years in complete darkness. This Pokemon absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees. It stays motionless as it waits for evolution.
290.alpha: Nincada lives underground. It uses its sharp claws to carve the roots of trees and absorb moisture and nutrients. This Pokemon can't withstand bright sunlight so avoids it.

435.omega: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.
435.alpha: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.

698.omega: This ancient Pokemon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.
698.alpha: This calm Pokemon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.

291.omega: Ninjask moves around at such a high speed that it cannot be seen, even while its crying can be clearly heard. For that reason, this Pokemon was long believed to be invisible.
291.alpha: If Ninjask is not trained properly, it will refuse to obey the Trainer and cry loudly continuously. Because of this quality, this Pokemon is said to be one that puts the Trainer's abilities to the test.

436.omega: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.
436.alpha: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

599.omega: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.
599.alpha: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

292.omega: Shedinja's hard body doesn't move—not even a twitch. In fact, its body appears to be merely a hollow shell. It is believed that this Pokemon will steal the spirit of anyone peering into its hollow body from its back.
292.alpha: Shedinja is a peculiar Pokemon. It seems to appear unsought in a Poke Ball after a Nincada evolves. This bizarre Pokemon is entirely immobile—it doesn't even breathe.

437.omega: In ages past, this Pokemon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.
437.alpha: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

293.omega: Normally, Whismur's voice is very quiet—it is barely audible even if one is paying close attention. However, if this Pokemon senses danger, it starts crying at an earsplitting volume.
293.alpha: Whismur is very timid. If it starts to cry loudly, it becomes startled by its own crying and cries even harder. When it finally stops crying, the Pokemon goes to sleep, all tired out.

438.omega: It prefers arid environments. It leaks water from its eyes to adjust its body's fluid levels.
438.alpha: It prefers an arid atmosphere. It leaks water that looks like tears when adjusting its moisture level.

294.omega: Loudred's bellowing can completely decimate a wood-frame house. It uses its voice to punish its foes. This Pokemon's round ears serve as loudspeakers.
294.alpha: Loudred shouts while stamping its feet. After it finishes shouting, this Pokemon becomes incapable of hearing anything for a while. This is considered to be a weak point.

699.omega: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.
699.alpha: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent's attack.

106.omega: Hitmonlee's legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.
106.alpha: Hitmonlee's legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.

439.omega: In an attempt to confuse its enemy, it mimics the enemy's movements. Then it wastes no time in making itself scarce!
439.alpha: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokemon.

295.omega: Exploud triggers earthquakes with the tremors it creates by bellowing. If this Pokemon violently inhales from the ports on its body, it's a sign that it is preparing to let loose a huge bellow.
295.alpha: Exploud communicates its feelings to the others by emitting whistle-like sounds from the tubes on its body. This Pokemon only raises its voice when it is in battle.

107.omega: Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had been working toward a world championship. This Pokemon has an indomitable spirit and will never give up in the face of adversity.
107.alpha: Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had been working toward a world championship. This Pokemon has an indomitable spirit and will never give up in the face of adversity.

296.omega: Makuhita is tenacious—it will keep getting up and attacking its foe however many times it is knocked down. Every time it gets back up, this Pokemon stores more energy in its body for evolving.
296.alpha: Makuhita has a tireless spirit—it will never give up hope. It eats a lot of food, gets plenty of sleep, and it trains very rigorously. By living that way, this Pokemon packs its body with energy.

108.omega: Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
108.alpha: Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.

297.omega: Hariyama practices its straight-arm slaps in any number of locations. One hit of this Pokemon's powerful, openhanded, straight-arm punches could snap a telephone pole in two.
297.alpha: Hariyama's thick body may appear fat, but it is actually a hunk of solid muscle. If this Pokemon bears down and tightens all its muscles, its body becomes as hard as a rock.

109.omega: If Koffing becomes agitated, it raises the toxicity of its internal gases and jets them out from all over its body. This Pokemon may also overinflate its round body, then explode.
109.alpha: Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas is concocted by this Pokemon.

298.omega: Azurill spins its tail as if it were a lasso, then hurls it far. The momentum of the throw sends its body flying, too. Using this unique action, one of these Pokemon managed to hurl itself a record 33 feet.
298.alpha: Azurill's tail is large and bouncy. It is packed full of the nutrients this Pokemon needs to grow. Azurill can be seen bouncing and playing on its big, rubbery tail.

660.omega: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.
660.alpha: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it's finished digging, it lounges lazily.

299.omega: Nosepass's magnetic nose is always pointed to the north. If two of these Pokemon meet, they cannot turn their faces to each other when they are close because their magnetic noses repel one another.
299.alpha: Nosepass had been said to be completely unmoving, with its magnetic nose pointed due north. However, close observation has revealed that the Pokemon actually moves by a little over 3/8 of an inch every year.

661.omega: These friendly Pokemon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.
661.alpha: Despite the beauty of its lilting voice, it's merciless to intruders that enter its territory.

662.omega: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.
662.alpha: The hotter the flame sac on its belly, the faster it can fly, but it takes some time to get the fire going.

704.omega: The weakest Dragon-type Pokemon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn't dry out.
704.alpha: It's covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.

705.omega: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can't see anything.
705.alpha: Its four horns are a high-performance radar system. It uses them to sense sounds and smells, rather than using ears or a nose.

706.omega: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokemon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.
706.alpha: It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch that's the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.

707.omega: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
707.alpha: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.

708.omega: These Pokemon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.
708.alpha: According to old tales, these Pokemon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.

709.omega: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.
709.alpha: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It's kind to the Pokemon that reside in its body.

730.omega: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.
730.alpha: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokemon's Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.

731.omega: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.
731.alpha: This Pokemon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.

732.omega: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.
732.alpha: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.

733.omega: When it battles, its beak heats up. The temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.
733.alpha: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.

734.omega: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.
734.alpha: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.

735.omega: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but it's always snoozing by nightfall.
735.alpha: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as it's diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokemon boasts incredible patience.

736.omega: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.
736.alpha: They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokemon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokemon.

737.omega: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.
737.alpha: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.

738.omega: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.
738.alpha: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokemon with shocking beams of electrical energy.

739.omega: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.
739.alpha: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.

760.omega: This immensely dangerous Pokemon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.
760.alpha: This Pokemon has the habit of hugging its companions. Many Trainers have left this world after their spines were squashed by its hug.

761.omega: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.
761.alpha: Although it's too sugary for human consumption, Bounsweet's sweat can be watered down into a juice with just the right amount of sweetness.

762.omega: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokemon, this Pokemon is totally fine.
762.alpha: This Pokemon is always bouncing around energetically. Other Pokemon are attracted by its lively appearance and pleasant aroma.

763.omega: Its long, striking legs aren't just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.
763.alpha: A Pokemon known for the beauty of its well-shaped legs, it sometimes appears as a mascot in advertisements for beauty salons.

764.omega: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.
764.alpha: Baths prepared with the flowers from its vine have a relaxing effect, so this Pokemon is a hit with many people.

765.omega: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokemon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it's best suited to veteran Trainers.
765.alpha: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokemon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

766.omega: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.
766.alpha: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.

767.omega: This Pokemon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.
767.alpha: Its habitat varies from beaches to seabeds. A natural scavenger, it will gleefully chow down on anything edible, no matter how rotten.

768.omega: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater—or even air—right in two.
768.alpha: It battles skillfully with its six arms, but spends most of its time peacefully meditating in caves deep beneath the sea.

769.omega: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokemon embodies the grudges of the departed.
769.alpha: It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth. And so it adds to the accumulation of its sand-mound body.

790.omega: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.
790.alpha: There's something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokemon may come from another world.

791.omega: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
791.alpha: This Pokemon is said to be a male evolution of Cosmog. At the activation of its third eye, it departs for another world.

792.omega: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.
792.alpha: Said to live in another world, this Pokemon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.

793.omega: One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.
793.alpha: One of the Ultra Beasts. It's unclear whether or not this Pokemon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.

794.omega: This Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.
794.alpha: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.

795.omega: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.
795.alpha: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.

796.omega: One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.
796.alpha: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.

797.omega: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.
797.alpha: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.

798.omega: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.
798.alpha: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.

799.omega: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. It's one of the Ultra Beasts.
799.alpha: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.

801.omega: This artificial Pokemon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.
801.alpha: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.

802.omega: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.
802.alpha: It lurks in the shadows of others, copying their movements and powers. This Pokémon is craven and cowering.

60.omega: Poliwag has a very thin skin. It is possible to see the Pokemon's spiral innards right through the skin. Despite its thinness, however, the skin is also very flexible. Even sharp fangs bounce right off it.
60.alpha: Poliwag has a very thin skin. It is possible to see the Pokemon's spiral innards right through the skin. Despite its thinness, however, the skin is also very flexible. Even sharp fangs bounce right off it.

61.omega: The surface of Poliwhirl's body is always wet and slick with a slimy fluid. Because of this slippery covering, it can easily slip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.
61.alpha: The surface of Poliwhirl's body is always wet and slick with a slimy fluid. Because of this slippery covering, it can easily slip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.

62.omega: Poliwrath's highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this Pokemon can swim back and forth across the ocean without effort.
62.alpha: Poliwrath's highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this Pokemon can swim back and forth across the ocean without effort.

63.omega: Abra sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense the presence of foes even while it is sleeping. In such a situation, this Pokemon immediately teleports to safety.
63.alpha: Abra needs to sleep for eighteen hours a day. If it doesn't, this Pokemon loses its ability to use telekinetic powers. If it is attacked, Abra escapes using Teleport while it is still sleeping.

64.omega: Kadabra emits a peculiar alpha wave if it develops a headache. Only those people with a particularly strong psyche can hope to become a Trainer of this Pokemon.
64.alpha: Kadabra holds a silver spoon in its hand. The spoon is used to amplify the alpha waves in its brain. Without the spoon, the Pokemon is said to be limited to half the usual amount of its telekinetic powers.

65.omega: Alakazam's brain continually grows, making its head far too heavy to support with its neck. This Pokemon holds its head up using its psychokinetic power instead.
65.alpha: Alakazam's brain continually grows, infinitely multiplying brain cells. This amazing brain gives this Pokemon an astoundingly high IQ of 5,000. It has a thorough memory of everything that has occurred in the world.

20.omega: Raticate's sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them ground down, it gnaws on rocks and logs. It may even chew on the walls of houses.
20.alpha: Raticate's sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them ground down, it gnaws on rocks and logs. It may even chew on the walls of houses.

66.omega: Machop's muscles are special—they never get sore no matter how much they are used in exercise. This Pokemon has sufficient power to hurl a hundred adult humans.
66.alpha: Machop exercises by hefting around a Graveler as if it were a barbell. There are some Machop that travel the world in a quest to master all kinds of martial arts.

21.omega: Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.
21.alpha: Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.

67.omega: Machoke's thoroughly toned muscles possess the hardness of steel. This Pokemon has so much strength, it can easily hold aloft a sumo wrestler on just one finger.
67.alpha: Machoke undertakes bodybuilding every day even as it helps people with tough, physically demanding labor. On its days off, this Pokemon heads to the fields and mountains to exercise and train.

22.omega: Fearow is recognized by its long neck and elongated beak. They are conveniently shaped for catching prey in soil or water. It deftly moves its long and skinny beak to pluck prey.
22.alpha: Fearow is recognized by its long neck and elongated beak. They are conveniently shaped for catching prey in soil or water. It deftly moves its long and skinny beak to pluck prey.

68.omega: Machamp has the power to hurl anything aside. However, trying to do any work requiring care and dexterity causes its arms to get tangled. This Pokemon tends to leap into action before it thinks.
68.alpha: Machamp is known as the Pokemon that has mastered every kind of martial arts. If it grabs hold of the foe with its four arms, the battle is all but over. The hapless foe is thrown far over the horizon.

23.omega: Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a glare from its upraised head.
23.alpha: Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a glare from its upraised head.

69.omega: Bellsprout's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pokemon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
69.alpha: Bellsprout's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pokemon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.

24.omega: This Pokemon is terrifically strong in order to constrict things with its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once Arbok wraps its body around its foe, escaping its crunching embrace is impossible.
24.alpha: This Pokemon is terrifically strong in order to constrict things with its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once Arbok wraps its body around its foe, escaping its crunching embrace is impossible.

25.omega: Whenever Pikachu comes across something new, it blasts it with a jolt of electricity. If you come across a blackened berry, it's evidence that this Pokemon mistook the intensity of its charge.
25.alpha: This Pokemon has electricity-storing pouches on its cheeks. These appear to become electrically charged during the night while Pikachu sleeps. It occasionally discharges electricity when it is dozy after waking up.

26.omega: If the electrical sacs become excessively charged, Raichu plants its tail in the ground and discharges. Scorched patches of ground will be found near this Pokemon's nest.
26.alpha: This Pokemon exudes a weak electrical charge from all over its body that makes it take on a slight glow in darkness. Raichu plants its tail in the ground to discharge electricity.

27.omega: Sandshrew's body is configured to absorb water without waste, enabling it to survive in an arid desert. This Pokemon curls up to protect itself from its enemies.
27.alpha: Sandshrew has a very dry hide that is extremely tough. The Pokemon can roll into a ball that repels any attack. At night, it burrows into the desert sand to sleep.

28.omega: Sandslash's body is covered by tough spikes, which are hardened sections of its hide. Once a year, the old spikes fall out, to be replaced with new spikes that grow out from beneath the old ones.
28.alpha: Sandslash can roll up its body as if it were a ball covered with large spikes. In battle, this Pokemon will try to make the foe flinch by jabbing it with its spines. It then leaps at the stunned foe to tear wildly with its sharp claws.

29.omega: Nidoran♀ has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pokemon. When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.
29.alpha: Nidoran♀ has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pokemon. When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.

110.omega: Weezing loves the gases given off by rotted kitchen garbage. This Pokemon will find a dirty, unkempt house and make it its home. At night, when the people in the house are asleep, it will go through the trash.
110.alpha: Weezing alternately shrinks and inflates its twin bodies to mix together toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed, the more powerful the toxins become. The Pokemon also becomes more putrid.

210.omega: Granbull has a particularly well-developed lower jaw. The enormous fangs are heavy, causing the Pokemon to tip its head back for balance. Unless it is startled, it will not try to bite indiscriminately.
210.alpha: Granbull has a particularly well-developed lower jaw. The enormous fangs are heavy, causing the Pokemon to tip its head back for balance. Unless it is startled, it will not try to bite indiscriminately.

111.omega: Rhyhorn runs in a straight line, smashing everything in its path. It is not bothered even if it rushes headlong into a block of steel. This Pokemon may feel some pain from the collision the next day, however.
111.alpha: Rhyhorn's brain is very small. It is so dense, while on a run it forgets why it started running in the first place. It apparently remembers sometimes if it demolishes something.

310.omega: Manectric is constantly discharging electricity from its mane. The sparks sometimes ignite forest fires. When it enters a battle, this Pokemon creates thunderclouds.
310.alpha: Manectric discharges strong electricity from its mane. The mane is used for collecting electricity in the atmosphere. This Pokemon creates thunderclouds above its head.

211.omega: Qwilfish sucks in water, inflating itself. This Pokemon uses the pressure of the water it swallowed to shoot toxic quills all at once from all over its body. It finds swimming somewhat challenging.
211.alpha: Qwilfish sucks in water, inflating itself. This Pokemon uses the pressure of the water it swallowed to shoot toxic quills all at once from all over its body. It finds swimming somewhat challenging.

112.omega: Rhydon's horn can crush even uncut diamonds. One sweeping blow of its tail can topple a building. This Pokemon's hide is extremely tough. Even direct cannon hits don't leave a scratch.
112.alpha: Rhydon has a horn that serves as a drill. It is used for destroying rocks and boulders. This Pokemon occasionally rams into streams of magma, but the armor-like hide prevents it from feeling the heat.

410.omega: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
410.alpha: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.

311.omega: Plusle always acts as a cheerleader for its partners. Whenever a teammate puts out a good effort in battle, this Pokemon shorts out its body to create the crackling noises of sparks to show its joy.
311.alpha: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokemon cries loudly.

510.omega: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.
510.alpha: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.

212.omega: Scizor has a body with the hardness of steel. It is not easily fazed by ordinary sorts of attacks. This Pokemon flaps its wings to regulate its body temperature.
212.alpha: Scizor has a body with the hardness of steel. It is not easily fazed by ordinary sorts of attacks. This Pokemon flaps its wings to regulate its body temperature.

113.omega: Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
113.alpha: Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.

411.omega: When they lined up side by side, no foe could break through. They shielded their young in that way.
411.alpha: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokemon that feeds on grass and berries.

610.omega: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
610.alpha: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

312.omega: Minun is more concerned about cheering on its partners than its own safety. It shorts out the electricity in its body to create brilliant showers of sparks to cheer on its teammates.
312.alpha: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokemon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.

511.omega: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokemon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.
511.alpha: It's good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It's kind enough to share them with friends.

213.omega: Shuckle quietly hides itself under rocks, keeping its body concealed inside its hard shell while eating berries it has stored away. The berries mix with its body fluids to become a juice.
213.alpha: Shuckle quietly hides itself under rocks, keeping its body concealed inside its hard shell while eating berries it has stored away. The berries mix with its body fluids to become a juice.

114.omega: Tangela's vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.
114.alpha: Tangela's vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.

412.omega: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.
412.alpha: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.

710.omega: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
710.alpha: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.

611.omega: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.
611.alpha: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

313.omega: With the arrival of night, Volbeat emits light from its tail. It communicates with others by adjusting the intensity and flashing of its light. This Pokemon is attracted by the sweet aroma of Illumise.
313.alpha: Volbeat's tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokemon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.

512.omega: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokemon is wild tempered.
512.alpha: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

214.omega: Heracross charges in a straight line at its foe, slips beneath the foe's grasp, and then scoops up and hurls the opponent with its mighty horn. This Pokemon even has enough power to topple a massive tree.
214.alpha: Heracross has sharp claws on its feet. These are planted firmly into the ground or the bark of a tree, giving the Pokemon a secure and solid footing to forcefully fling away foes with its proud horn.

115.omega: If you come across a young Kangaskhan playing by itself, you must never disturb it or attempt to catch it. The baby Pokemon's parent is sure to be in the area, and it will become violently enraged at you.
115.alpha: If you come across a young Kangaskhan playing by itself, you must never disturb it or attempt to catch it. The baby Pokemon's parent is sure to be in the area, and it will become violently enraged at you.

413.omega: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.
413.alpha: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokemon's body. The cloak is never shed.

140.omega: Kabuto is a Pokemon that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in extremely rare cases, living examples have been discovered. The Pokemon has not changed at all for 300 million years.
140.alpha: Kabuto is a Pokemon that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in extremely rare cases, living examples have been discovered. The Pokemon has not changed at all for 300 million years.

612.omega: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
612.alpha: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokemon are covered in hard armor.

314.omega: Illumise attracts a swarm of Volbeat using a sweet fragrance. Once the Volbeat have gathered, this Pokemon leads the lit-up swarm in drawing geometric designs on the canvas of the night sky.
314.alpha: Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. This Pokemon is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.

711.omega: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
711.alpha: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.

513.omega: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.
513.alpha: This Pokemon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

215.omega: Sneasel scales trees by punching its hooked claws into the bark. This Pokemon seeks out unguarded nests and steals eggs for food while the parents are away.
215.alpha: Sneasel scales trees by punching its hooked claws into the bark. This Pokemon seeks out unguarded nests and steals eggs for food while the parents are away.

240.omega: Magby's state of health is determined by observing the fire it breathes. If the Pokemon is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.
240.alpha: Magby's state of health is determined by observing the fire it breathes. If the Pokemon is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.

116.omega: Horsea eats small insects and moss off of rocks. If the ocean current turns fast, this Pokemon anchors itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away.
116.alpha: If Horsea senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This Pokemon swims by cleverly flapping the fin on its back.

414.omega: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by Combee.
414.alpha: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.

141.omega: Kabutops swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient times. The Pokemon was apparently evolving from being a water dweller to living on land as evident from the beginnings of change in its gills and legs.
141.alpha: Kabutops swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient times. The Pokemon was apparently evolving from being a water dweller to living on land as evident from the beginnings of change in its gills and legs.

613.omega: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.
613.alpha: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.

315.omega: Roselia shoots sharp thorns as projectiles at any opponent that tries to steal the flowers on its arms. The aroma of this Pokemon brings serenity to living things.
315.alpha: On extremely rare occasions, a Roselia is said to appear with its flowers in unusual colors. The thorns on this Pokemon's head contain a vicious poison.

340.omega: Whiscash is extremely territorial. Just one of these Pokemon will claim a large pond as its exclusive territory. If a foe approaches it, it thrashes about and triggers a massive earthquake.
340.alpha: If Whiscash goes on a wild rampage, it sets off a quake-like tremor with a radius of over three miles. This Pokemon has the ability to predict real earthquakes.

514.omega: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.
514.alpha: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

216.omega: This Pokemon likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.
216.alpha: This Pokemon likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.

241.omega: Miltank gives over five gallons of milk on a daily basis. Its sweet milk is enjoyed by children and grown-ups alike. People who can't drink milk turn it into yogurt and eat it instead.
241.alpha: Miltank gives over five gallons of milk on a daily basis. Its sweet milk is enjoyed by children and grown-ups alike. People who can't drink milk turn it into yogurt and eat it instead.

117.omega: Seadra sleeps after wriggling itself between the branches of coral. Those trying to harvest coral are occasionally stung by this Pokemon's poison barbs if they fail to notice it.
117.alpha: Seadra generates whirlpools by spinning its body. The whirlpools are strong enough to swallow even fishing boats. This Pokemon weakens prey with these currents, then swallows it whole.

415.omega: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers honey from flowers to please Vespiquen.
415.alpha: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

142.omega: Aerodactyl is a Pokemon from the age of dinosaurs. It was regenerated from genetic material extracted from amber. It is imagined to have been the king of the skies in ancient times.
142.alpha: Aerodactyl is a Pokemon from the age of dinosaurs. It was regenerated from genetic material extracted from amber. It is imagined to have been the king of the skies in ancient times.

614.omega: They love the cold seas of the north. They create pathways across the ocean waters by freezing their own breath.
614.alpha: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.

316.omega: Virtually all of Gulpin's body is its stomach. As a result, it can swallow something its own size. This Pokemon's stomach contains a special fluid that digests anything.
316.alpha: Most of Gulpin's body is made up of its stomach—its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokemon's stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.

341.omega: Corphish were originally foreign Pokemon that were imported as pets. They eventually turned up in the wild. This Pokemon is very hardy and has greatly increased its population.
341.alpha: Corphish catches prey with its sharp claws. It has no likes or dislikes when it comes to food—it will eat anything. This Pokemon has no trouble living in filthy water.

515.omega: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.
515.alpha: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

217.omega: In the forests inhabited by Ursaring, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This Pokemon walks through its forest gathering food every day.
217.alpha: In the forests inhabited by Ursaring, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This Pokemon walks through its forest gathering food every day.

242.omega: Blissey senses sadness with its fluffy coat of fur. If it does so, this Pokemon will rush over to a sad person, no matter how far away, to share a Lucky Egg that brings a smile to any face.
242.alpha: Blissey senses sadness with its fluffy coat of fur. If it does so, this Pokemon will rush over to a sad person, no matter how far away, to share a Lucky Egg that brings a smile to any face.

118.omega: Goldeen is a very beautiful Pokemon with fins that billow elegantly in water. However, don't let your guard down around this Pokemon—it could ram you powerfully with its horn.
118.alpha: Goldeen loves swimming wild and free in rivers and ponds. If one of these Pokemon is placed in an aquarium, it will shatter even the thickest glass with one ram of its horn and make its escape.

416.omega: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.
416.alpha: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.

441.omega: It mimics the cries of other Pokemon to trick them into thinking it's one of them. This way they won't attack it.
441.alpha: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

615.omega: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.
615.alpha: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.

143.omega: Snorlax's typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pokemon that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.
143.alpha: Snorlax's typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pokemon that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.

342.omega: Crawdaunt has an extremely violent nature that compels it to challenge other living things to battle. Other life-forms refuse to live in ponds inhabited by this Pokemon, making them desolate places.
342.alpha: Crawdaunt molts (sheds) its shell regularly. Immediately after molting, its shell is soft and tender. Until the shell hardens, this Pokemon hides in its streambed burrow to avoid attack from its foes.

516.omega: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.
516.alpha: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

640.omega: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.
640.alpha: Legends say this Pokemon confounded opponents with its swift movements.

243.omega: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokemon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.
243.alpha: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokemon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.

119.omega: In the autumn, Seaking males can be seen performing courtship dances in riverbeds to woo females. During this season, this Pokemon's body coloration is at its most beautiful.
119.alpha: Seaking is very protective of its eggs. The male and female will take turns patrolling around their nest and eggs. The guarding of eggs by these Pokemon goes on for over a month.

417.omega: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.
417.alpha: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

442.omega: A Pokemon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.
442.alpha: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

616.omega: When it and Karrablast are together, and both receive electrical stimulation, they both evolve.
616.alpha: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.

144.omega: Articuno is a legendary bird Pokemon that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this Pokemon flies, snow will fall.
144.alpha: Articuno is a legendary bird Pokemon that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this Pokemon flies, snow will fall.

343.omega: Baltoy moves while spinning around on its one foot. Primitive wall paintings depicting this Pokemon living among people were discovered in some ancient ruins.
343.alpha: As soon as it spots others of its kind, Baltoy congregates with them and then begins crying noisily in unison. This Pokemon sleeps while cleverly balancing itself on its one foot.

517.omega: This Pokemon appears before people and Pokemon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.
517.alpha: It eats the dreams of people and Pokemon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.

641.omega: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
641.alpha: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

244.omega: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokemon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.
244.alpha: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokemon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.

418.omega: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
418.alpha: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

317.omega: When Swalot spots prey, it spurts out a hideously toxic fluid from its pores and sprays the target. Once the prey has weakened, this Pokemon gulps it down whole with its cavernous mouth.
317.alpha: Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokemon's mouth.

443.omega: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.
443.alpha: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.

617.omega: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.
617.alpha: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

145.omega: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokemon that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. The Pokemon gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.
145.alpha: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokemon that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. The Pokemon gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.

344.omega: Claydol are said to be dolls of mud made by primitive humans and brought to life by exposure to a mysterious ray. This Pokemon moves about while levitating.
344.alpha: Claydol is an enigma that appeared from a clay statue made by an ancient civilization dating back 20,000 years. This Pokemon shoots beams from both its hands.

518.omega: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokemon.
518.alpha: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.

642.omega: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.
642.alpha: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

245.omega: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokemon has the power to purify dirty water.
245.alpha: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokemon has the power to purify dirty water.

419.omega: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
419.alpha: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

270.omega: Lotad live in ponds and lakes, where they float on the surface. It grows weak if its broad leaf dies. On rare occasions, this Pokemon travels on land in search of clean water.
270.alpha: Lotad is said to have dwelled on land before. However, this Pokemon is thought to have returned to water because the leaf on its head grew large and heavy. It now lives by floating atop the water.

444.omega: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
444.alpha: As it digs to expand its nest, it habitually digs up gems that it then hoards in its nest.

618.omega: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.
618.alpha: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

146.omega: Moltres is a legendary bird Pokemon that has the ability to control fire. If this Pokemon is injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.
146.alpha: Moltres is a legendary bird Pokemon that has the ability to control fire. If this Pokemon is injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.

345.omega: Lileep became extinct approximately a hundred million years ago. This ancient Pokemon attaches itself to a rock on the seafloor and catches approaching prey using tentacles shaped like flower petals.
345.alpha: Lileep is an ancient Pokemon that was regenerated from a fossil. It remains permanently anchored to a rock. From its immobile perch, this Pokemon intently scans for prey with its two eyes.

519.omega: This very forgetful Pokemon will wait for a new order from its Trainer even though it already has one.
519.alpha: These Pokemon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.

370.omega: Luvdisc live in shallow seas in the tropics. This heart-shaped Pokemon earned its name by swimming after loving couples it spotted in the ocean's waves.
370.alpha: Luvdisc's heart-shaped body is a symbol of love and romance. It is said that any couple meeting this Pokemon is promised a loving relationship that never ends.

246.omega: Larvitar is born deep under the ground. To come up to the surface, this Pokemon must eat its way through the soil above. Until it does so, Larvitar cannot see its parents.
246.alpha: Larvitar is born deep under the ground. To come up to the surface, this Pokemon must eat its way through the soil above. Until it does so, Larvitar cannot see its parents.

643.omega: This legendary Pokemon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.
643.alpha: When Reshiram's tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world's weather.

271.omega: Lombre is nocturnal—it will get active after dusk. It is also a mischief maker. When this Pokemon spots anglers, it tugs on their fishing lines from beneath the surface and enjoys their consternation.
271.alpha: Lombre's entire body is covered by a slippery, slimy film. It feels horribly unpleasant to be touched by this Pokemon's hands. Lombre is often mistaken for a human child.

445.omega: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.
445.alpha: It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.

619.omega: It takes pride in the speed at which it can use moves. What it loses in power, it makes up for in quantity.
619.alpha: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.

470.omega: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you'll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.
470.alpha: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.

346.omega: Cradily roams around the ocean floor in search of food. This Pokemon freely extends its tree trunk-like neck and captures unwary prey using its eight tentacles.
346.alpha: Cradily's body serves as an anchor, preventing it from being washed away in rough seas. This Pokemon secretes a strong digestive fluid from its tentacles.

147.omega: Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.
147.alpha: Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.

371.omega: Bagon has a dream of one day soaring in the sky. In doomed efforts to fly, this Pokemon hurls itself off cliffs. As a result of its dives, its head has grown tough and as hard as tempered steel.
371.alpha: Bagon harbors a never-ending dream of one day soaring high among the clouds. As if trying to dispel its frustration over its inability to fly, this Pokemon slams its hard head against huge rocks and shatters them into pebbles.

247.omega: Pupitar creates a gas inside its body that it compresses and forcefully ejects to propel itself like a jet. The body is very durable—it avoids damage even if it hits solid steel.
247.alpha: Pupitar creates a gas inside its body that it compresses and forcefully ejects to propel itself like a jet. The body is very durable—it avoids damage even if it hits solid steel.

644.omega: This legendary Pokemon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.
644.alpha: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

570.omega: It changes so it looks just like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.
570.alpha: Bonds between these Pokemon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

446.omega: It hides food under its long body hair. However, it forgets it has hidden the food.
446.alpha: It conceals food under the long fur on its body. It carts around this food stash and swallows it without chewing.

148.omega: Dragonair stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter weather conditions in its vicinity by discharging energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.
148.alpha: Dragonair stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter weather conditions in its vicinity by discharging energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.

471.omega: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.
471.alpha: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.

347.omega: Anorith was regenerated from a prehistoric fossil. This primitive Pokemon once lived in warm seas. It grips its prey firmly between its two large claws.
347.alpha: Anorith is said to be a type of Pokemon predecessor, with eight wings at the sides of its body. This Pokemon swam in the primordial sea by undulating these eight wings.

272.omega: Ludicolo begins dancing as soon as it hears cheerful, festive music. This Pokemon is said to appear when it hears the singing of children on hiking outings.
272.alpha: Upon hearing an upbeat and cheerful rhythm, the cells in Ludicolo's body become very energetic and active. Even in battle, this Pokemon will exhibit an amazing amount of power.

670.omega: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.
670.alpha: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.

248.omega: Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a whole mountain to make its nest. This Pokemon wanders about in mountains seeking new opponents to fight.
248.alpha: Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a whole mountain to make its nest. This Pokemon wanders about in mountains seeking new opponents to fight.

372.omega: Inside Shelgon's armor-like shell, cells are in the midst of transformation to create an entirely new body. This Pokemon's shell is extremely heavy, making its movements sluggish.
372.alpha: Covering Shelgon's body are outgrowths much like bones. The shell is very hard and bounces off enemy attacks. When awaiting evolution, this Pokemon hides away in a cavern.

571.omega: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.
571.alpha: These Pokemon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.

447.omega: It uses the shapes of auras, which change according to emotion, to communicate with others.
447.alpha: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

149.omega: Dragonite is capable of circling the globe in just 16 hours. It is a kindhearted Pokemon that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.
149.alpha: Dragonite is capable of circling the globe in just 16 hours. It is a kindhearted Pokemon that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.

472.omega: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
472.alpha: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

348.omega: Armaldo's tough armor makes all attacks bounce off. This Pokemon's two enormous claws can be freely extended or contracted. They have the power to punch right through a steel slab.
348.alpha: Armaldo is a Pokemon species that became extinct in prehistoric times. This Pokemon is said to have walked on its hind legs, which would have been more convenient for life on land.

273.omega: Seedot attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. It sucks moisture from the tree while hanging off the branch. The more water it drinks, the glossier this Pokemon's body becomes.
273.alpha: Seedot looks exactly like an acorn when it is dangling from a tree branch. It startles other Pokemon by suddenly moving. This Pokemon polishes its body once a day using leaves.

671.omega: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.
671.alpha: In times long past, governors of castles would invite Florges to create flower gardens to embellish the castle domains.

249.omega: Lugia's wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokemon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.
249.alpha: Lugia's wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokemon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.

373.omega: Salamence came about as a result of a strong, long-held dream of growing wings. It is said that this powerful desire triggered a sudden mutation in this Pokemon's cells, causing it to sprout its magnificent wings.
373.alpha: By evolving into Salamence, this Pokemon finally realizes its long-held dream of growing wings. To express its joy, it flies and wheels all over the sky while spouting flames from its mouth.

572.omega: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.
572.alpha: Cinccino's body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.

448.omega: By catching the aura emanating from others, it can read their thoughts and movements.
448.alpha: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.

274.omega: Nuzleaf live in densely overgrown forests. They occasionally venture out of the forest to startle people. This Pokemon dislikes having its long nose pinched.
274.alpha: This Pokemon pulls out the leaf on its head and makes a flute with it. The sound of Nuzleaf's flute strikes fear and uncertainty in the hearts of people lost in a forest.

473.omega: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokemon has been around a long, long, long time.
473.alpha: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.

349.omega: Feebas's fins are ragged and tattered from the start of its life. Because of its shoddy appearance, this Pokemon is largely ignored. It is capable of living in both the sea and in rivers.
349.alpha: While Feebas's body is in tatters, it has a hardy and tenacious life force that enables it to live anywhere. However, this Pokemon is also slow and dimwitted, making it an easy catch.

645.omega: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”
645.alpha: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.

672.omega: Thought to be one of the first Pokemon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.
672.alpha: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

374.omega: Instead of blood, a powerful magnetic force courses throughout Beldum's body. This Pokemon communicates with others by sending controlled pulses of magnetism.
374.alpha: Beldum keeps itself floating by generating a magnetic force that repels earth's natural magnetism. When it sleeps, this Pokemon anchors itself to a cliff using the hooks on its rear.

646.omega: This legendary ice Pokemon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.
646.alpha: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

573.omega: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.
573.alpha: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokemon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

449.omega: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.
449.alpha: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

275.omega: Shiftry is a mysterious Pokemon that is said to live atop towering trees dating back over a thousand years. It creates terrific windstorms with the fans it holds.
275.alpha: Shiftry's large fans generate awesome gusts of wind at a speed close to 100 feet per second. The whipped-up wind blows anything away. This Pokemon chooses to live quietly deep in forests.

474.omega: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokemon. It began acting oddly, however.
474.alpha: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error...

647.omega: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.
647.alpha: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

170.omega: Chinchou lets loose positive and negative electrical charges from its two antennas to make its prey faint. This Pokemon flashes its electric lights to exchange signals with others.
170.alpha: Chinchou's two antennas are filled with cells that generate strong electricity. This Pokemon's cells create so much electrical power, it even makes itself tingle slightly.

673.omega: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.
673.alpha: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

375.omega: When two Beldum fuse together, Metang is formed. The brains of the Beldum are joined by a magnetic nervous system. By linking its brains magnetically, this Pokemon generates strong psychokinetic power.
375.alpha: When two Beldum fuse together, Metang is formed. The brains of the Beldum are joined by a magnetic nervous system. This Pokemon turns its arms to the rear for traveling at high speed.

171.omega: Lanturn is nicknamed “the deep-sea star for its illuminated antenna. This Pokemon produces light by causing a chemical reaction between bacteria and its bodily fluids inside the antenna.
171.alpha: Lanturn is known to emit light. If you peer down into the dark sea from a ship at night, you can sometimes see this Pokemon's light rising from the depths where it swims. It gives the sea an appearance of a starlit night.

574.omega: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
574.alpha: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.

276.omega: Taillow courageously stands its ground against foes, however strong they may be. This gutsy Pokemon will remain defiant even after a loss. On the other hand, it cries loudly if it becomes hungry.
276.alpha: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokemon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.

648.omega: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokemon that hear them happy or sad.
648.alpha: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

475.omega: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
475.alpha: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.

172.omega: Pichu charges itself with electricity more easily on days with thunderclouds or when the air is very dry. You can hear the crackling of static electricity coming off this Pokemon.
172.alpha: When Pichu plays with others, it may short out electricity with another Pichu, creating a shower of sparks. In that event, this Pokemon will begin crying, startled by the flash of sparks.

173.omega: On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these Pokemon quench their thirst with the morning dew.
173.alpha: On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these Pokemon quench their thirst with the morning dew.

674.omega: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.
674.alpha: It does its level best to glare and pull a scary face, but it can't help grinning if anyone pats its head.

376.omega: Metagross has four brains in total. Combined, the four brains can breeze through difficult calculations faster than a supercomputer. This Pokemon can float in the air by tucking in its four legs.
376.alpha: Metagross is the result of two Metang achieving fusion. When hunting, this Pokemon pins the prey to the ground under its massive body. It then eats the helpless victim using the large mouth on its stomach.

318.omega: Carvanha's strongly developed jaws and its sharply pointed fangs pack the destructive power to rip out boat hulls. Many boats have been attacked and sunk by this Pokemon.
318.alpha: If anything invades Carvanha's territory, it will swarm and tear at the intruder with its pointed fangs. On its own, however, this Pokemon turns suddenly timid.

575.omega: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.
575.alpha: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers' life spans.

277.omega: Swellow flies high above our heads, making graceful arcs in the sky. This Pokemon dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. The hapless prey is tightly grasped by Swellow's clawed feet, preventing escape.
277.alpha: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other's wings.

649.omega: This ancient bug Pokemon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
649.alpha: This Pokemon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

476.omega: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
476.alpha: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.

174.omega: Igglybuff's vocal cords are not sufficiently developed. It would hurt its throat if it were to sing too much. This Pokemon gargles with freshwater from a clean stream.
